Reviews.Title: Fantastic!!!! Really is waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Dukie564
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on a whim before our honeymoon to the Caribbean. Both of us are avid photographers and normally use SLR cameras, but wanted something in the small point-and-shoot category, and something we didn't have to be afraid of dropping or getting wet, and that we could use underwater. This camera impressed us so much that we didn't take our SLR out of it's case a single time the entire trip! It held up to a week of constant use though sun, sand, water, and dust without a hitch, and not a single foggy or blurry photo. We took it snorkeling in up to 10 feet of water for hours at a time and it took fantastic photos with no issue during or afterwards. Drop it in the sand? Rinse it off in the ocean!Another impressive thing about this camera is the sheer number of settings and photo modes. The filters are incredibly accurate and processing was super fast (INSTANT). Even processing for the panorama mode (which works great!) was completed in under 10 seconds. My wife loved the "pop art" and "dramatic" settings, and the FOUR underwater modes all worked perfectly.Not sure what "Lucas Smith" is talking about with his review that talked about the battery life. Our battery easily lasted though each day (200-300 photos and video, 6+ hours a day) without dying a single time. The battery/SD card/charging port double lock was very easy to operate, and didn't let a single grain of sand or drop of water into the area the entire trip.Construction is great - no loose or flimsy pieces, and when powered down a METAL door automatically slides over the lens to protect it from dirt and dust.Focusing and firing is EXTREMELY fast. Almost instant - leaving plenty of time for multiple simultaneous shots of action filled activities. I was able to easily squeeze off 3-4 shots in 3 seconds (no flash), all of them in focus.The LCD screen is the best i've seen on a camera yet - easily viewable in bright sunlight and even underwater, crystal clear, and sharp.Taking video is effortless thanks to the separate record button on the back corner, no fumbling with the settings to enable recording mode vs shooting mode. I do wish that I was able to snap still shots while recording though, but it's easy enough to extract images from the video once you load it onto your computer, and since the videos are in 1080p the images are still sharp and clear.I have yet to test the freeze-proof and crush-proof claims, but based on the durable construction and water-proof performance I have little doubts about their accuracy.BOTTOM LINE: If you're looking for an extremely flexible and durable "tough" point and shoot camera, look no further than this one. It will satisfy everyone from the beginner photographer to the professional, and I still wouldn't be afraid to hand it to my friend's kids to use at the beach or in the pool. If i could give it 6 stars I would. A++ Olympus - this one is a home run.

Reviews.Title: Fast And Ruggest, but very harsh Image Quality IMHO
Reviews.Author: Lucas Smith
Reviews.Content: I am trying to find a good waterproof camera for surfing/snorkling (I live in Hawaii :-) ).  I got this because the sound recording on 2 Canon powershot d20's stoped working for me. I liked just about everything (other than the speed and strap placement of the d20), but obviously there is a problem with waterproofing as the sound stopped recording correctly on both of them after a snorkling trip.Fast forward 2 weeks and now I have the Olymus tg-820 which I decided to try over the older Nikon AW100 and the significantly more expensive Olympus TG-1.  I knew that people didn't think the Video recording was great on the TG-820, and that the battery life was subpar, but it looks like the best of the three options for my budget.  The summary is that there are some good things about this camera, but again I either got unlucky (again) or there is a quality issue with the CMOS sensor as the image quality leaves a lot to be desired.  Most of my comparisons are going to be between the D20 and the TG-820 as I have had hands on with both of them.Pros:1) Very fast compared to Canon Powershot D20.  The biggest improvment is the between shot time which is closer to .2 seconds vs 1 second on the d20.  The burst mode is much better too!2) Strap placement is much better3) Battery/SD card door is double lock, but easier to use than the D20 which i almost broke a fingernail trying to open.4) Construction appears a little better than the D20 (which had a couple rough edges on some of the frame pieces.5) Lens cover - not sure if this is a pro or con.  Helps keep lens cleaner in pocket, but another mechanical part to possibly fail.6) More easily accessable Manual control options than the D20.7) No issues with sound recording yet, and the speaker while not great is definitly louder than than the D20 which i could barely hear.Cons:1)***Image quality is very very .  ..  struggling to come up with the right word.  Harsh or Violent seems to best fit.  Basically there is a good bit of detail in the pictures (probably a bit more than the D20), and zoomed out the images look pretty good, but as soon as you zoom in there are terrible artifacts around all edges, blotches on solid or gradient surfaces, and a good bit of chromatic aberations, and obvious ISO noise everywhere (particularly in the dark areas).  I have tried playing around with all the settings (dynamic range correction, decreasing JPEG compression, JPEG size, ISO settings, etc . .), and pretty much anything above 100 ISO or maybe 200 ISO is too noisy in my opinion and even 100 ISO has the JPEG edge artifacts.  While noise inceased and detail decreased on the higher ISO on the D20, I felt like up to 1600 ISO was usable.  Not so at all on the TG-820.  The camera has a tendency to shot at ISO400 and use flash on every picture indoors.  The D20 would usually not use flash but shoot at ISO 800 and I found the pictures to be far better.  Needless to say for a camera with supposed great low light performance I was pretty disapointed.  I have gone back and looked at sample images for the TG-1 and now that I know what I am looking for they look a lot less noisy (presumably due to the f2.0 lens as well requiring lower ISO settings).  I tried to upload an example picture to Amazon so you could see what i am talking about, but unfortunatly Amazon smooths out pictures and reduces their quality to save space so you couldn't see the issues.  Playing around with post processing by adding noise reduction in Adobe lightroom definitly helps stuff out, but you loose a lot of detail by the time you get rid of enough noise.2) Autofocus isn't as acurate and hunts around a bit, especially in video mode.3) No highspeed video mode.  This feels like a total oversight on Olympus's part.  The processor is obviously much faster than the D20, but has no 120 or 240 FPS video modes like most of the competing tough cams do.4) Video quality isn't as good as D20 either - appears mostly related to compression artifacts and the autofocus issues5) I am getting pretty good at the joystick buttom control, but it is definitly touchy, and I almost always make a mistake when applying the settings I want the first time.6) Camera modes are a bit confusing and not as intuative as the D20s.  Although there are more options, a lot of them don't seem very usefull (like the 4 different underwater modes - probably only Underwater Wide 1 is any use- and you still have to manually turn the flash setting off).Overall - Promissing aside from the image quality.  It honestly looks like a processing issue to me more than necessarily just the sensor or lens, but hard to tell without seeing RAW images off the camera.  I am probably going to return mine as the image quality is a bit of a deal breaker for me.  Not sure what I will try next??  Maybe try the TG-1 or Nikon AW100 (tempted to wait for Nikon to release a new model though).  Even though I really like the speed of the TG-820 I would definitly take the Canon D20 over it (if i could get one that the mic didn't fail on me).  Maybe your expirience will differ, so good luck to anyone trying this.**** updates ****Ok, so i think i figured out what is going on with regards to image quality.  The camera is apply a high level of sharpening along with agressive jpeg compression.  Doing the same action in Adobe Lightroom gives me similar results.  The level looks very overdone to me and it doesn't look like there is anyway to disable it.  Not zoomed in the images look fine, but zoomed in the effect is that the whole image looks harsh, and it creates what appears to be artifacts around edges (like eyes and mouths).  I honestly don't notice it too much elsewhere, but on the eyes and mouth this is particularly anoying.  The ISO noise isn't as bad as I thought it was initially and is decent up to ISO 800.  It is really the auto sharpening and compression that is bad.Couple other grips in additional testing:1) Underwater modes are pretty useless.  The main one that is closest to usefull forces the flash (terible thing to do in most underwater shots), and if you disable the flash it is reenabled the next power cycle.  So i am just using normal program mode with underwater white balance.  Color balance isn't very good though, and there is a very blue cast on just about everything.  Doesn't look terrible though.2) The focus hunting in videos is more anoying that i thought initially, and unless you are videoing a stationary subject you probably won't be happy with the focus.  The 60fps video vs 24fps on the canon d20 is nice though.3) battery is very week.  Barely made it though 1 1/2 hour snorkling trip (100 pictures and 5 videos) and it was almost dead.  This would be a serious limitation.I am 95% sure this camera is going to be returned, but i will give it another week to try to find some fixes for the sharpening, and video focus.Summary:-1 star for Image Quality issues (was -2, but now i understand what is going on better)--1 star for video focus issues-1 star for poor battery life-1 star for useless underwater modes, touchy controls, no highspeed video, etc. .+1 star for speed (generally very fast and snappy)+1 star for durability and battery compartment access (so far so good which is better than the canon d20s i had)****

Reviews.Title: Really Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Probst
Reviews.Content: I recently picked up the TG820 for my 9 YO daughter (her 3rd P&S; camera) now that she has taken a fancy to photography.  I purchased it at a local camera shop for no more than what it would have cost buying online.  In doing my pre-purchase research I saw that Nikon offers a model with similar features that seems to be very popular right now. However, after previously buying my daughter the inexpensive (ie, less than $100) Nikon L22 and then the next iteration L24, I no longer have any confidence whatsoever in the quality of the components in the Nikon point & shoot cameras since the battery cover broke on each camera after minimal use. I believe that this is something Nikon had to be fully aware of before introducing the L24 as the problem appeared to be well documented in L22 reviews.  After comparing the features of the Olympus TG820 to the Canon, Nikon, Pentax, & Sony rugged-type cameras, I liked what I saw in this model the best, including the fact that it does not have GPS and the picture taking lens has what appears to be a rugged automatic lens cover when the camera is switched off.  I also don't expect to have problems with the double-locking, tight-sealing, metal-hinged battery cover.Based on our limited experience, this camera takes wonderfully detailed, clear, quality snapshots with rich, satisfying colors. The LCD viewfinder is razor sharp.  The macro feature is extremely good and has 2 different settings.  Best of all, the camera has been so much fun to use. My daughter says it's "really cool". I've owned and used a number of P&S; cameras (and DSLRs) and have not enjoyed any camera as much as I have this one.  My daughter especially likes the 'fragmented' special effect and has taken some really brilliant, well composed shots using this feature.  They look so good that I'm considering having several enlarged (possibly up to 16x20).  We had the camera with us in the swimming pool today to take stills and video.  We did our shooting on, in, and under the water and were totally in awe tonight after reviewing our results on a large computer monitor.  To sum up in one word what we saw -  "WOW!"While I would love to give the TG820 a full 5 stars, there are 3 reasons I won't. While video was not the purpose I got this camera, I find the video performance to be just OK at best.  Maybe we still need to become more familiar with shooting video with this camera but focus seems a bit hit or miss/here or there.  Of greater concern however is the joystick and how difficult it can be to accurately navigate though one's choices. I see another reviewer called this a glaring error and I must agree. Navigating with the joystick pretty much requires use of one's fingernail and not the fingertip to be able to press only the very outer edge of this button (ie, the joystick) in the intended direction.  A little too much pressure (very little actually) away from the edge will usually result in an unintentional selection, thus requiring you to get out of what you've landed in and re-start the process from the beginning - sometimes multiple times.  It took me nearly 10 minutes to set the time and date because of this 'touchiness', a task that should take no more than a minute.  Finally, it does not come with a separate battery charger so the battery can only be charged in the camera while the camera is connected to a computer or plugged in an outlet, thus taking the camera out of service while the battery charges (about 1-3 hours).  If you carry and use a 2nd battery, you'll have to consecutively re-charge each battery in the camera.In spite of the above short-comings, I would still highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a rugged, take anywhere camera that can be used in most any environment including under water because it takes really great photos and is really fun to use.6/30/11 - The battery life on our camera is less than desirable, actually it's quite dismal.  I would highly recommend having a second charged battery on hand to swap out the partially run down battery if you're planning to do a lot of shooting between charges.  We currently have taken approx 800 shots after 5 days on our family vacation.  We have had to swap out the battery after a morning of shooting to ensure that we can shoot the rest of the day since one battery has yet to last an entire day of shooting.  Not making the swap after a morning of shooting has resulted in a dead battery in the early afternoon.  We have found that charging both batteries sequentially every night after a day of shooting or just charging one battery whenever we have a break of several hours avoids the disappointment of a dead battery.7/1/11 - Video performance: I shot several short videos in the past week and I will retract my previous comments about the 'poor' video quality.  It does video OK and I would use the TG-820 again to shoot short videos.  The image quality I now think is very good while the microphone, as one would expect, is just adequate enough to pick up nearby sounds.  Flash performance:  Using the camera indoors for flash photos generally produced crisp, well-exposed results at the distances we were shooting (typically 3-11 feet).  The red-eye reduction flash feature worked great.Based on our 3 weeks with the TG-820 including a week-long vacation where we took over 1000 photos, we know we can take the TG-820 anywhere and come back with great pictures!  Everything considered, my rating remains 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Little All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: Lynette M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TG-820 camera in mid-May for an upcoming trip to Bermuda and both my wife and I were extremely impressed. We have not purchased a digital camera for about 6 years or more and no longer use our old digital video camera due to its size and complexity. I thought it would be a great idea to buy a camera to capture my snorkeling and our yearly trips. I was very skeptical about the waterproof feature since according to the reviews on virtually all of these underwater cameras there is a fairly high failure rate. Well, after snorkeling 3 times in Bermuda and capturing some great stills and video I can say that so far this camera is working extremely well. My wife also captured some great (and funny) video and stills as we zipped around the island on our scooter. I am not a photographer and neither is she but I found that using many of the different modes worked extremely well. In particular the sunset mode and panorama mode were especially useful. I will likely use many of the other modes as I become more familiar with the camera. I left the setting on the auto mode and this worked well for her shots from the back of the scooter. As far as the layout of the buttons, I have large hands and had no issues with the toggle switch and actually thought it worked rather well despite another review here. The LCD screen is great but I had some trouble seeing it when snorkeling and watching the video afterward on the camera screen was initially disappointing but when I transferred the video to my computer the video was amazing and I was thrilled at the videos of parrot fish I was able to shoot. The audio was weird and a bit disappointing initially but again when I transferred to my computer and played through the computer speakers it was much better. Really can't expect much from such a tiny microphone/speaker. Overall this was a great purchase and I would highly recommend this camera. I took over 400 pictures/video which is way more than I ever have in the past which illustrates how much fun this camera was to use. Follow the directions for care after underwater use and you should be good to go. Buy & enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!!
Reviews.Author: busybee
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a week but I am in love!  This is my second Tough camera.  My first was the 1030SW and it was a phenomenal camera!  I was sad it got water logged after several years of use.  I'm pretty sure it was my doing too, not a malfunction in the camera.  I replaced that camera with the Panasonic Lumix TS10 and really do not like that camera.  Feel free to read my review of it to learn why.*FYI - I'm not a professional photographer and I'm sure more technically minded people will have different opinions about small technical things.This newest Tough TG-820 is awesome.  The display screen is large and extremely clear.  It's like watching a mini-HDTV.  I really like the video button since it is so easy to switch between photo and video.  I have a toddler so this feature makes it easy to capture quickly the various silly things he does on a daily basis.  I love how quickly a photo is displayed in the LCD after pressing down the shutter.  I read that it can take multiple photos in a row if the file size is smaller but I haven't experimented very much yet.  The toggle is good and bad.  This is my first toggle on a camera so I feel like it's a bit sensitive to the touch but I'm sure I'll get used to it.  Everything is selected using the toggle (ie, flash, macro, timer, etc.).  I like how the photos do a thumbnail slideshow when holding the toggle to the left or right.  The auto-lens cover is loud when it closes.  It actually has startled me.  The camera is on the heavier side.  It's definitely larger than my first Tough camera.  It has a power save feature and an auto-off feature but I think it takes about 10 minutes to shutoff.  I haven't yet tested this camera in the water but if it's anything like my first Tough camera, I know I'll be happy.  The built-in speaker isn't very good.  One thing that I find as an annoyance with this newest model is that it did not come with a battery charger.  The camera is supposed to be plugged in to charge the battery via USB or AC power adapter.  Not exactly convenient.  I am happy to still have the battery charger from my first Tough camera so I don't have to worry about this.  I recommend buying a battery charger and extra batteries.I only gave this camera 4 stars due to the various small issues listed above but overall, I think this camera is great and I highly recommend it.  It is an expensive camera but the quality is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Most under=rated camera
Reviews.Author: Capt Patt Meara
Reviews.Content: A retired photojournalist, I was photographing rough water action in the Virgin Islands with a Canon digital SLR and very expensive lens. The man standing next to me was using a TG-820, waterproof, small, and rugged. Comparison of the final photos from the two cameras displayed little difference between similar images. I ordered the camera the next day and carry it with me constantlytg-820

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: engrstudent1984
Reviews.Content: I would like to start this review by saying that I am not a professional photographer. I do, however, enjoy taking photographs as a hobby and have a few cameras and basic working knowledge of aperature settings, shutter speeds, ISO setting, etc. If you want a thorough, in-depth review of the camera and every single feature then I recommend going to a photography or Olympus' website, if you want a practical review for the average/hobbyist photographer then please keep reading.This was the first point and shoot camera I purchased in a while. Before this, my everyday camera was a fixed lens Fujifilm camera that is not nearly as tough. Therefore I needed something that I could take with me on vacation to the beach, kayaking, hunting, to family events with young children where I wouldn't take a nicer camera, tripod, bag, etc. anyway. For the features and price of this camera you cannot go wrong.Paired with a Sandisk ExtremeSD card (you'll want a fast SD card to transfer HD video off the camera) I have taken probably 1000 pictures and some video in the last two weeks and will describe some of the features I like about this camera. In no particular order:1. Burst Mode Shooting - I have never had a camera that had this feature and now realize that I could never do without. A recent example of where this comes in handy was visiting my sister who has a 4 week old. Taking pictures of babies/children can be a gamble as you never know when they will smile, look in the right direction, etc. Using this feature I was able to take nice quick bursts of images capturing the brief moment when the baby was not crying and smiling big right at the camera! I believe the camera would work just fine at any local sporting event, etc.2. Durability/Waterproofing - This was a main reason in purchasing the camera. I like the outdoors. I hunt, I fish, I kayak, I snorkel, you name it. Having taken a number of cruises and tacking on a snorkling/kayking trip I was the "look at that guy, he thought to bring a waterproof (albeit disposable) camera." Having used those throw away cameras a number of times with the high film exposure speed, you learn quickly that the pictures are grainy, incorrectly exposed, etc. Half the time the pictures just plain stink and you have no instant feedback after the shot. Do I think this camera should be used for deep sea exploration? No. Do I think the underwater  features/capabilities are sufficient for the average joe to shoot great pictures to share with their friends of a trip to Grand Cayman Reef? Yes, yes, yes. I just recently took a trip to St. Thomas and St. Maarten and this camera was great out on a boat and in the water. Just make sure you buy a floating camera strap...3. Instant HD video - So easy just push the button and record. Video is high quality. Microphone is not the best but this is a point and shoot camera that takes takes video as good as any microHD camcorder with comparable sound. Those cameras wont go underwater, at least right out of the box anyway. Again, if you want to shoot short films for the Cannes Film Festival buy a purpose built device, if you want to shoot quick videos of your daughter's 6th birthday party this will work just fine. What is nice is some of the "Magic Filters" carry over into the video recording. Which brings me to...4. Magic Filters - These filters add some great effects to pictures. Sure some are garish and silly but some are downright cool. I particulary like the "Pop Art" filter which draws out bright colors by making them even brighter and more vivid (think Andy Warhol). Also interesting is the fish eye "lens" (self-explanatory) and dramatic lens filter which seems just to be a High Dynamic Range image post-processed within the camera. If you don't know what it is, look it up. The effect makes the pictures look pretty wicked and dark/sinister in some cases. All this without having to buy photo editing software. I won't go into all the filters but they are fun an offer a neat distraction to turn an otherwise boring picture into something far more interesting.I could go on but at the expense of becoming superfluous in my write-up I will just sum up. Buy this camera, with the exception of the harshest, most particular photographers, you will not be disappointed. Although I would recommend camera to those more picky photographers anyway as I think the cost alone justifies the purchase...if you drop it you didn't just break that $500 lense and damage that fancy SLR camera body.

Reviews.Title: For the middle east adventurers out there. . .if you know what I mean.
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I don't usually comment, but this camera is worth it for guys like us.  I was looking for a durable camera after having spent $100 here and there on various cameras on previous combat deployments.  They were all disappointing.  I did a lot of research on cameras this time around and I decided to go with this one.  I put this camera in my front pocket without a case.  I've banged this camera against the ground with full kit on, slammed it against up-armored vehicles, scraped it against jagged walls while climbing over them and just basically have been abusing it.  As you can see it has been beat up pretty bad.  It's been wet, in the hot sun and in the cold.  Haven't had a malfunction with it yet; still works perfectly fine.  The buttons are easy to use even with gloves on.  The pictures are great, but then again this is from a guy that doesn't know too much about photography.  And the easy to use record button, is the best feature in my opinion.I gave it four stars because it has turned on in my pocket a couple of times and it has a loud beeping noise when doing so.  It has only happened four times in the past 6 months that I've had it, but you can see how this could be bad on night ops.  Good thing is when it does turn on and I don't notice it, the battery life is pretty descent where it will last the whole day.  Also I was a little hesitant of the price, but I said screw it, because who knows if I was even going to make it back from this deployment right.  At least I would have some good pictures that my buddies could look at whilst remembering how much of a $#!% bag I was.  Haha!  Happy hunting.De Oppresso LiberP.S.  I also have the contour roam for a helmet cam.  You have to buy the attachment for the ops core helmet also on the contour website or on amazon.

Reviews.Title: Favorite Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Laura-Jane Barber
Reviews.Content: I own the red one.There are so many things to love about this camera!First - It's waterproof!  I loved being able to carry it around the pool and lazy river on vacation.  There were no worries of anyone stealing it because I could take it in the water with me the entire time.  Plus, it captured amazing shots both under and above the water.  I had fun playing around with the pool/beach setting versus the underwater still and action settings.  Love love love it!Second - It's dummy-proof.  I love that it has a ton of settings with explanations built in the camera.  When you change the setting, it not only shows you a preview of the type of photograph for which that setting is ideal, but also explains it briefly in words.  I have never felt more confident playing around with the various settings on any camera.  I especially love the action setting.  I have two small children and gone are the blurry action shots!3rd - The battery life is pretty awesome.  I took over 200 pictures and videos each day of the vacation and by bedtime, the camera still had two bars of battery remaining.  I charged it each night just in case.  I should note that I followed the instructions and turned off the camera when it was not in use and am sure that helped preserve the battery life.4th - It uses rechargeable batteries.  I received this as a gift and would have been disappointed if it hadn't been rechargeable.  I love that I can either charge it in the wall or to my computer using the exact same cord.I have not tested out the "tough" feature though with kids, I'm sure it will be dropped eventually.  If you plan to use it in the water, I do recommend getting the floating camera case.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kiera Kittie
Reviews.Content: This is one Fantastic little camera, I was afraid it would be bulky but its not, its pocket friendly with a very comfy shape to grip. I am a photography hobbyist, not a professional by any means and I was seeking a good camera to take out on my Geocaching adventures, without fear of breaking it. Though I have only had this camera a few hours, in just testing it out I am amazed at the photo quality. The HyperCrystal Viewer in the back makes looking through your photos easy, the bright colors are very easy to see in the sunlight. I haven't seen any issues with glare. the buttons are easy to maneuver and scroll with. It takes fantastic shots of my pets, getting a picture of them, actually sitting still is almost impossible. All I could get where blurry, movement blobs. I took this camera outside with them and for once I have some extremely cute photos of my pets running around that are crystal clear!Now I have not tried "All" the features as of yet, I haven't thrown it against a wall, sat on it. I will update as it performs, specially if anything goes wrong.I have however, dunked it in my fishtank and took some AMAZING close up pictures of my Big fish! I was nervous at first but it worked perfectly.It will take some getting used to just like any new items. My old Camera was an Olympus Stylus 600, this is a Huge upgrade to me, but thankfully its not so different in controls and options where I'm lost. I cant wait to take this camera for its first Geocaching hike through the parks!So far the only few things I don't like, don't have much to do with the camera its self. The box does not come with a very informative book to flip through. Just a few basic info folded papers. It does come with a CD-Rom that I haven't used yet since my netbook doesn't have a CD drive. Also, as some have said elsewhere, I wish it came with an actual battery charger station, instead of having to charge the battery with it in the camera. I plan to try my old battery charger or buying one so I can carry extra batteries while I'm out on the trails.UPDATE: 7/26/12Still takes wonderful pictures under water, It did take a lot of tweaking to figure out how to record properly, it seems a tad shaky and "woobly" when zooming in and out. Its really hard to get the video recorder to re-focus once it goes out of focus on something. Over-all I am still very happy with this camera, BUT I am going to move my 5 stars down to 4. Mostly for the video recording hiccups. I have also noticed I have a hard time getting the camera to focus on the target I am wanting it to, it likes to focus off to the side, or behind it alot. Though that might just me user error. :)Update: 12/12/12 - 04/01/13Camera somehow got an odd mark or fuzz or something under the lens that I could not clean off no matter what I tried. I was advised to mail the camera back and I did after the holidays, thankfully, since it took over a month for them to "fix" it and send it back to me. I went right back to taking pictures, everything seemed fine. They said they updated the firmware, when I tried to shoot video's after receiving my camera back, it would lock up and freeze, I would have to remove the battery to shut it down. I tried to place it in water and take a picture of some fish and noticed that it now leaked ALL around the camera buttons.. Soo, here I mailed it back once more..This time it took about two weeks, they mailed me a whole new camera. Not black like I had, but Silver. I don't mind I suppose, it works and everything seems good so far. I don't like that I still had about 3 months of my original warranty on my old camera but this one they mailed me with a 15 day warranty.. So far though, so good, everything is back in working order, they were very nice on the phone each time and seemed to want to help.

Reviews.Title: Better than the Nikon AW100.
Reviews.Author: N. Wassmer
Reviews.Content: I've waited a couple of months to post a review for this camera because I wanted to make sure that I took it through its paces. In a sentence, The Olympus TG-820 is a fantastic outdoor camera that doesn't need to be babied like many other proclaimed "tough cameras" .I spent a lot of time comparing the reviews and specs for many cameras within this "tough camera" segment. It all boiled down to the Nikon AW100 and the Olympus TG-820 for my price range and functionality requirements.I chose the Olympus over the Nikon for many reasons. The TG-820 in nearly 100 dollars cheaper than the Nikon and had more useful features to my shooting habits.Reasons I chose TG-820 over the AW100:1. TG-820 has more than double the screen resolution of the AW100(1,030K dots vs. 460k dots)2. TG-820 can shoot up to 5fps over the Nikon's 3 allowing for better action shots3. TG-820 has better low light performance with a maximum ISO of 6,400 compared to the Nikon's 3,200What the TG-820 does well:Waterproof:The TG-820 performed extremely well in and out of the water. I took this camera snorkeling in Fiji, and I had zero problems with its claims of being waterproof up to 33 feet. All of the ports on the camera have rubber seals that lock tightly and secure the camera from water, with the battery and SD card compartment having a double locking system to make sure you don't accidentally open the compartment.The 5x optical lens is housed completely inside of the camera so there is no protruding part to get bent or broken allowing the camera to maintain a tight water seal. To test this, I gave this camera to local spear fisherman on my trip to get some cool under water pictures. After the fact, I found out the camera was taken to depths of nearly 50 feet without any mechanical problems.Menus:The menus on the camera are not overly complex, but switching shooting modes and ISO are only accessible by navigating the onscreen menus. There are no designated buttons on the camera, or a touch screen to quickly toggle your settings. This could be a buzz kill for some people wanting to change settings quickly, but once you get the hang of the settings menu, it's very manageable.*Just found the "tap control" setting on this camera, which allows the user to tap the sides of the camera with their finger to navigate the menus. To access this function, tap the designated menu button and scroll down until you are in settings menu 3, you will find the tap control function here. Switch tap control on and you are presented with a configuration menu that allows you to change the sensitivity and location of each tap. I would still prefer physical buttons, and I'm not sure how useful this feature is because its slower than using the toggle stick, but at least it presents the user with more options.Picture:This camera does take pretty good photos. The image is sharp and has good color saturation in all varieties of light. Some reviewers have mentioned that the camera overly sharpens the image. I agree that the in-camera sharpening is a little harsh, but by no means enough to deter someone away from buying this camera. The other positive features far outweigh this one little gripe.Effects:I know that effects are gimmicky with many modern cameras, however the TG-820 brings a new style to them. If you enable the "magic mode" in shooting selection, you can choose from a variety of filters that appear in real-time on your camera. This allows you to see what your picture will look like with the filter applied before you take the photo, eliminating the pointless minutes of applying filters after the fact that most likely won't look good. The effects listed are pop art, pin hole, fish eye, drawing, soft focus, punk (looks like the old dancing apple ipod ads,) sparkle, watercolor, reflection. miniature, fragmented and dramatic (produces HDR effect.)ISOIn a previous review I had mentioned that this camera does well at high ISOs. I can no longer say this is true. With further use, I have found that ISOs over 800 produce a fair amount of noise, with images tending to be especially noisy when shooting indoors. High ISOs still might be better when shooting underwater, but be warned that if you want to print the picture in a large format, it will be noisy.My recommendation is that you turn off auto ISO and try to keep the camera below 800 for the best possible photos.Negatives:-The finish on the outside of the camera, along with the screen are prone to scratching.-No physical buttons for switching modes.-Overly sharp images.-Not the best when it comes to High ISO noise levelsOverall, great camera to take on outdoor adventure trips because of its rugged build and great picture abilities. I would highly recommend this product to anyone wanting camera  functionality at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: wife's choice
Reviews.Author: Michael P Riddelle
Reviews.Content: Just got the Olympus TG 820 for my wife, she saw an ad for it and thought she had to have it. She has been searching for a camera that is fast enough to catch our 2 two year old grandchildren, and is also compact and easy to use. She is so pleased with this camera, she even got a picture of a humming bird at our feeder. She's the kind of person who hates reading instruction manuals and with this camera she didn't have to. The 820 is very user friendly, the viewing screen is sharp,the flash is quick and so is the focusing, the controls are a little sensitive, but you get use to that. The biggest problem with this camera  is that you must plug in the camera in order to charge the battery, it would have been much better with a separate charger so you can charge one battery while using the camera.Great little camera, would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Interesting Camera for Outdoor Use but with One Major Problem.
Reviews.Author: David J. Inman
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting little camera for outdoor work.  Since it is shock resistant and water resistant, one can take shots in bad weather without worries.  I am an underwater photographer and my UW camera rig is a lot larger and more complex than this little guy, but I think the camera does have topside uses for me.I also like the macro and super-macro function for the small stuff.  It even has a little macro light.I had one problem which actually caused me to return the camera for a replacement.  When I would unplug the camera after charging the battery, the LED screen would go blank for a period of time.  It would come back on in a matter of minutes or hours, but the defect was enough to motivate me to sent for a replacement.  I guess the good news is that I like the camera enough to persevere with it.

Reviews.Title: Used and Abused. Super Tough!
Reviews.Author: Tony Whitcomb "AJW509"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 16 year old daughter for a trip to Belize. 10 Days in the jungle. Dropped off a small mountain. Taken to double the rated depth at 60 feet. Bumped and scraped the whole way....3500 Pictures from Belize in perfect shape back in the states! Priceless!!! Love this little camera and it's tough enough for us, the rest of you should be just fine :)

Reviews.Title: WORKED PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Rickey Meyer
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera being a little skeptical.... Worked just fine, had it a week in the Keys snokeling (actually my son used it and even with him not being careful as I would it was fine) a friend that went bought the Lumix brand and he wanted to use mine more, he had no problems but the the water tight aspects were better on the Olympus brand.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good for general purpose
Reviews.Author: Ali Roustai
Reviews.Content: I bough this camera as a replacement for my Samsung I85.Pros:-Solidly build yet quiet light-Good overall Image Quality and Pleasing colors(for a point and shoot)-Fast auto-focus.-Excellent start up and fast frame rate you can catch those special moments with this..-good battery life and cheap generic batterys are availableCons:There are quiet a few but nothing too bad-Zoom in and out about average.-Details can be muddy if you are in a shade area in both pictures and video.-Skin  tone in pictures come out  too soft for my tast...  I guess this can be a plus if you like beauty shots with softer tone. This is also the main reason I returned the camera.-Dynamic range is only decent as long as you turn on the shadow lighting option-Like pretty much all the point and shots that I have tried,  this camera suffers from having too big of megapixel for the sensors size it has. Which can affect the details and the dynamic rangeWith my old Samsung i85 which was an 8 mp camera, the shadows and the grays seem to come out much better both in color and detail.-Video quality is just ok. My little Sony tx7 seem to take better quality videos, but the image quality is not as good as this one.-Focus can be tricky at times especially if you are shooting at fast frames.I ended up returning this camera

Reviews.Title: So close....
Reviews.Author: mjyfins
Reviews.Content: I like most everything about this camera.  However, what I don't like is pretty glaring.  First, the likes.  Picture quality is a lot better than previous models of this camera.  Great waterproof and "drop-proof" capability.  Cool options and features.  Now, the bad.  The buttons make it VERY difficult to view pics and change modes on the first try.  It's inconceivable that Olympus can make such advancements in this camera and let it go to market with this glaring weakness.  It kind of reminds me of one of those old appliances that has buttons that barely work but you're hesitant to spend the money to replace it!  Well, you get this from the get-go with this camera.  It's too bad.  Also, the battery life is way too short for a camera like this.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Good Underwater Photos and Video, But Badly Placed Video Button, Difficult Mode Switching, and Poor Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Not my real name guy
Reviews.Content: 3.75/5 StarsI bought an Olympus TG820 cheap used off eBay after reading the most recent group waterproof camera review roundup on dpreview.com (now affiliated with Amazon, Digital Photography Review is probably the best digital camera website on the internet) that rated the top-of-the-line Olympus TG-2 the highest.  Basically the review said that the $400 TG-2 was about the only camera that had decent colors without a blue-ish cast underwater, but also said that every camera in this class that they tested had mediocre image quality with noisy photos.  So, rather than plunk down around 3 c-notes (Olympus sometimes has refurbished TG-2s on their website for $250), I figured I'd spend less than one third that amount and try one of their mid-range TG820s instead.  I also figured I'd probably keep it for my trip to Hawaii this year for beach photos and underwater photos snorkeling, then maybe just re-sell it on eBay for what I paid for it or even a little profit.  Ultimately, I decided to keep it, although it does have two moderately significant faults.PROS:- It takes surprisingly good images underwater, the main reason I bought it. They do not have the blue cast that most other brands deliver underwater.  I've posted a bunch of them here in the user photo section from snorkeling expeditions off Lahaina, Maui (surprisingly good for how shallow it is) and from Lanai's Hulopoe Beach (fantastic - highly recommend the Trilogy sailing catamaran snorkeling trip there).  Most photos have been cropped, most touched up just with Photoshop Elements Auto Smart Fix, but several are noted to have no editing.  Most were taken with the Underwater Wide 1 scene setting. I can blow most of these up to 8" x 10" and have good prints.- 1080p HD Video is quite good - I took several underwater videos, videos at the beach and then when we returned to the frozen north from our Hawaii trip, several videos skiing and I think they really turned out well, at least as well as those from my Canon S100, which originally was $150 or $200 more than this Olympus and as well as the 720p video on my old $700 Lumix G2 Micro 4/3 interchangeable lens camera.  One can zoom during video, but the mechanized zoom is quite slow.- Some photos are surprisingly good and can easily be blown up to 8x10 size without showing any noise or artifacts.  The secret is to keep the ISO set as low as possible and unless shooting outdoors in good light, try to use modes where one can select ISO independent of the camera's AI, which will try to force a higher ISO setting to reduce shutter speed.- The color rendition was very pleasing.  It's been more than a decade since I last used an Olympus camera and I was surprised at how vibrant the colors were compared to those of Panasonic digital cameras (which I've used the most over the past 5 years, which do not do a good job with colors in the red portion of the spectrum) and compared to the more neutral (and maybe more accurate) Canon colors. I had two other digital cameras with me on the trip to Hawaii, a Canon S100 and a Panasonic ZS19, and the TG820 most faithfully reproduced the rich blue and turquoise oceans I saw.- The camera is quite quick to start up - I'd say easily 1 second from hitting the power button to shooting the first photo.- The fun/funky scene and special effects modes are entertaining and can produce some neat effects.  The beauty mode was especially entertaining when I pointed out that it took twice as long to process photos of one friend compared to another.- The camera has a heavy, aluminum case that is quite sturdy and has a quality feel to it.  The battery/SD card compartment has a sturdy double latch on it that effectively keeps the camera waterproof.- Flash is actually a bit stronger than average for P&S; pocketable cameras.CONS:- The Video start button is horribly placed in the thumb rest on the back of the camera.  It is very easy to start recording inadvertently, but even worse, just by shifting grip slightly, one can inadvertently depress that button again and shut the video off.  I lost at least three pretty important videos of my daughter on the beach, underwater, and trailside at the mountain, thinking that I was recording the video and being too actively involved with keeping balanced and aiming the camera to notice that I had stopped recording after only a few seconds.- Battery life is poor, around maybe 200 photos.  I lost out on 20 minutes worth of snorkeling videos when I had to walk back to the boat to find my spare battery.- Controls are poorly implemented and it's difficult to switch between modes on the fly, under a time pressure to get a shot.  90+% of cameras use a mode dial for a very good reason - it's easy to see how to switch from IA or P to a Scene mode on a dial, but when one has to press the joystick/OK button and then try to remember which way to maneuver with the joystick to get through the menus, it takes a lot longer.- Limited 5x zoom range would be nicer if it went a bit wider or a bit longer, but this is identical with almost all waterproof "tough cam" digital cameras of this genre, except a few that just came out in 2014.CONCLUSION:Overall, I'd recommend this camera for its very effective waterproof build that can lead to very nice underwater photos, plus it has good HD video.  It has a lot of features and can capture some very decent photos, comparable to other pocketable point-and-shoot digital cameras in the $150-200 range, provided you keep the ISO at 100 - any increase in ISO above that level will lead to grainy, noisy photos, as many of the less-positive reviews have commented.  However, this is mostly the result of what has happened with most lower end digital cameras, trying to put too many megapixels onto too small of a sensor and as a result, having too little detail in the images it captures - this is not unique at all.

Reviews.Title: A little skeptical at first...but quite impressed!
Reviews.Author: sharon crofts
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for our vacation to St. Thomas and St. John.  I was a little nervous as to how well it would work.  We used it snorkeling every day.  We were really impressed with the pictures...especially for the price.  I would totally recommend this, obviously you can spend a lot more on a camera and probably get better pictures, but for the price we thought it was great!  It was so fun to have all the underwater pictures.  We didn't have any problem with the battery dying.  We used it a lot in the water everyday and I would just charge it every night to be safe.My husband kept commenting how impressed he was with the quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, ultra-fast shutter, and as durable as advertised!
Reviews.Author: Trav
Reviews.Content: Takes pictures AMAZINGLY fast. Also, I dropped this from shoulder high while hiking the black hills.  It fell right onto a rock. The aluminum body took a hit right around the lens. Just a minor scratch, and the camera still functions flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Good camera witth a ton of features
Reviews.Author: M. Dettmer
Reviews.Content: For an all weather camera, this devices is pretty good. Its been under water in a pool and in the ocean for most of this summer. It has a lot of features to find the best shooting option. I think the only thing is the battery life, it doesn't last quite as long as other digital cameras that I have owned in the past. Other then that its pretty good.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first SPORT camera. I did much research and this is the winner. Solid (metal), waterproof (have taken pics to 10ft depth in salt water with no problems), drop resistant (dropped it once but didn't tell wife) and it takes great pics. I have 5 digital cameras but I will never go on vacation again without this one!

Reviews.Title: Olympus tg-820 12mp
Reviews.Author: Christian Perchaluk
Reviews.Content: good camera.  good underwater.  strap gets in the way but make sure you have some sort of flotation device attached to it if you go in deep unclear waters.  and get a case.  just a slip on one

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: Great capabilities. Amazing zoom. Big viewing screen. Easy usb access. Fantastic under water picture taking ability. Great color. Easy set up.

Reviews.Title: Should have gone straight for this camera series a long time ago.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Andrew Tse
Reviews.Content: Around the same price as a medium range point-and-shoot with all the protective features, this camera has exceeded my expectations. I actually left my DSLR in my luggage during most of my last vacation in favor of using this little guy which performed beautifully.

Reviews.Title: Love tough stylus cameras for years, this model is garbage!
Reviews.Author: R. Bruce "kiapet.com"
Reviews.Content: I still have my Stylus 400 from over 10years ago, have bought many over the years, I had the 8010 ( two of them) bought this TG-820 iHS in Feb..  takes great picts, ZERO complaints, but video is HORRIBLE, I was excited about 1080 as the 8010 on shot 720p, well the TG-820 iHS does a few things wrong, the first and most important is the focusing looses it BIG time... cannot hold it, so much so that I was at a surf event last month and Olympus had a booth promoting them and I showed two employees what was u with the focus on the TG-820 iHS demo's they had on hand, and only then did the one guy say, well yes we are hoping a firmware is coming out soon as we have seen on the forums people complain, the other thing that I noticed while filming out while paddling is not only the horrible focusing that goes blurry often, but while zooming in you get a song that plays.. it's NOT good at all, you can go to youtube and search SUP with my pup, Chihuahua Street STray rescue. and you will be able to listen, now this is not an issue if your filming something that's loud or planning on dubbing in music, but if you want to zoom in on wildlife or what not that is quiet you will be unhappy to say the least... watch the clip notice the crappy focusing and also listen when I zoom in and hear clicking, and then some sort of tune...  I'm sending this pile of garbage back to Olympus and hope they upgrade to the next model as this unit is a epic FAIL! I've owned about 12 models over the years.... I normally shoot with Canon DSLR but the tuff for a snapshot normally can't be beat.... the reason I didn't upload the vid here is it is 300meg and they limit you to 100meg.. Don't get me wrong the tuff series is normally great just steer clear of the 820ihs

Reviews.Title: Underwater Experience
Reviews.Author: Monir
Reviews.Content: Amazing pictures captured while snorkeling, in water parks and at the pool. Great way to catch the family fun both above and under the water.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value, great pictures, and great price.
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: This camera is priced well for what you get out of it.Takes great photos and videos both indoors and outdoors.  Shot to shot recover time is incredible outdoors (no flash) and respectable indoors (flash charge time is around 1.5 seconds).The only thing I didn't like about this camera was how you have to charge the battery.  I don't like charging the battery INSIDE the camera using a USB cable.  That was easy enough to fix though, I just purchased a 2-spare battery kit with an external charger.  Problem solved!It is very well made, seals up well for underwater pictures, and has a lot of great modes to choose from.  I especially like the auto-magic panorama mode.  After you snap the first picture, I has dots you line up in the LCD view-screen to take the next two shots of your panorama, then it auto-magically stitches them all together for you.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Kassay "Rebecca"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our Hawaiian honeymoon and were amazed at the ability to take great underwater photos while snorkeling. It enhanced the trip (and our memories) in a wonderful way. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P. Singer
Reviews.Content: This camera is solid so I feel safe leaving it in my purse or pocket and taking it with me wherever I go. It takes very good pictures and it is easy to use. Lots of cool settings to play around with.I was nervous when I first examined it because the "OK" button looks a little fragile for a camera that's supposed to be so rugged. I have a feeling that if anything were to break on this camera, that button might be one of the first things to go.Haven't tried it underwater yet, but definitely looking forward to the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley Jimenez
Reviews.Content: Has already withstood the dreaded "toddler test." Husband was pleased with it as apparently it's the type used in his line of work (refinery inspection), so it must be tough.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I ever had!
Reviews.Author: Ricarda Schiller
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! I bought it for my Mexico vacation and used the camera almost every day under water (snorkeling, scuba diving, water parks, ...) and for all the other interesting things! I always cleaned the camera (in a cup of water if I had too) after using it in saltwater. Almost 6 months later I am still a huge fan of the camera and can highly recommend it! It is fun to play around with all the functions!

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-820
Reviews.Author: R. J. Antunes
Reviews.Content: Very nice durable camera, takes great pictures. I use it kayaking, ATVing, and back woods. Exceptional telephoto shots of wildlife.

Reviews.Title: Alternate to S4 Phone Camera
Reviews.Author: I. Spencer
Reviews.Content: Worked great for snorkeling in Hawaii and general rugged hiking conditions. Pictures turned out great and the versatility of this camera is a huge plus. I'm generally taking pictures with a camera in places where I wouldn't want to pull out my phone, so this is the ideal camera for me.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J Man
Reviews.Content: Produced good underwater pictures and was fairly easy to use, although zoom toggle could be more accomodating.  No problems during multiple underwater sessions in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: It's the Baby Bear of Cameras - Just Right!
Reviews.Author: ConstantLearning "noahsmom"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a trip to Dry Tortugas. I wanted something small to tote around, something waterproof for snorkeling, and something that would stand up to camping and heavy use. My last camera was ruined by a single grain of sand! This camera matched all our requirements!  It worked perfectly on our trip, took fabulous photos under and above water and held up to everything. I wasn't worried about letting the kids use it.  I wish I had purchased it a few months before the trip so I would have had more time to play around with the settings and figure out how it works but that is the ONLY regret I have with my purchase. It is easy to use, easy to carry and is a pretty color. Even though we are back from our travels, I continue to use it over my larger digital camera. I love that the battery is rechargeable! My other camera really goes through the batteries and that gets expensive!  I did purchase a set of 2 extra batteries with a wall charger and I would highly recommend them! We always had batteries charged and ready to use. It was important to have our photos turn out from this once-in-a-lifetime trip and this camera really delivered.  It has a lot of settings for underwater and many for scenes above the water. I've seen cameras with more settings, but this one had all the important ones for all the scenes you will need on a trip. Plus - I always get confused and overwhelmed with a hundred different settings. This one made it easy to choose. It's the baby bear of cameras - JUST RIGHT.

Reviews.Title: Really great camera!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Walker
Reviews.Content: Love everything about this camera! However the instructons and directions are printed in Chinese! It would be just a little easier to have ones that I could read.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Christine Schramm
Reviews.Content: Now, this is a point and shoot camera. Keep that in mind. It will not take the same quality photo as a DSLR simply because the lenses are different. Anyone with a working knowledge of photography will understand that.I got the camera for our upcoming trip down the shore and to Disney World. I wasn't about to bring down my nice camera to Florida where rain is an everyday occurrence.I haven't been able to take it underwater in a pool, but I have taken a few snapshots in my two fishtanks (one brackish and one fresh) and it took wonderful shots.It has a great macro mode and some snazzy effects with it.It's the best P&S; I've used.

Reviews.Title: Great rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: Survived my 7 day cruise to Alaska. Took it underwater and  it had a beat down in a kayak. Took over 600 pics and 10 videos.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what i need
Reviews.Author: Chief Calusa
Reviews.Content: Great nicely priced, it will do very nice above and below water. So far the pictures I`ve taken have been extremely nice.It does take some time if you want quality pictures. Point and shoot features work, but the quality happens when you use your manual settings!

Reviews.Title: best outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Pumphrey
Reviews.Content: I have used Oympus point and shoot style cameras for years because they have always had a weather or water proof model. Olympus makes a tough camera that offers beautiful color reproduction, clarity and sharpness.  This is an ideal outdoor sports camera.  I take it hiking and kayaking.  The battery life is good, but a second battery is pretty important.  I purchased this particular camera to replace one I had drowned by submerging it in a lake w/ the battery door open.  It is a real testament to Olympus durabitly to note that the camera I had submerged dried out in a couple of weeks and is still operational, still takes clear photos and all the features; including the display screen, still work.

Reviews.Title: exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use in our trip to Key Largo after reading several reviews for various brands and models ranging from $100-250.  My husband and son are divers and I wanted them to take pictures so I could see ocean life too.  I honestly expected something fatal to happen to the camera during one of their dives, but as long as we were able to get some decent pics on the memory card first, I would have been happy anyway.  They took it on two dives -- one that was about 30-35 ft deep, and the camera held up wonderfully! We have some great photos I can't wait to show our friends and family!  I also took it to the water park and just loved that I can take it anywhere with me and not worry that it will get wet.  This is clearly one of the nest purchases I've made.  The picture quality underwater isn't fantastic, but is fine, and for the price, I didn't expect it to be great.  The above water pictures are pretty decent. No match to my Nikon DSLR, of course, but better than I expected for the price I paid.  And I can't take the Nikon in water, so there you have it.  I would definitely recommend this camera for novice underwater photography!

Reviews.Title: Met all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Neil Clark
Reviews.Content: This is a well designed camera. It has many functiond that are relatively easy to get to onceone becomes familiar with the menu. Even has a built in "How to" section.

Reviews.Title: Great so Far!
Reviews.Author: David "D10"
Reviews.Content: Used it in Key Largo and got some great shots underwater on some of the beautiful reefs. I followed the directions and rinsed it after every salt water use and it's still working. My only complaint is that the lens is not in the middle of the camera and I find myself getting a finger from my left hand in the frame. Oh well, I'll just have to adjust I guess. Oh, and I bought the float strap to take some of the fear out of passing the camera around when out on the water.

Reviews.Title: Great point and click waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Clarke Pich
Reviews.Content: We took it to Grand Cayman with us and it took great photos when we were snorkeling.  The 33 ft is plenty of room to use in almost any snorkeling site.  Definitely recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great - glad we bought it
Reviews.Author: Brad L
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera prior to a cruise to the Caribbean and didn't have much time to look at it before we left.  It turned out that it was very easy to use and it worked just great.  The picture quality was superb and we had no problems whatsoever with it.  Just make sure you clean it thoroughly after being in salt water.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the pool
Reviews.Author: Marilyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hoping to get something that would take good pictures at the pool (both in and out of the water). This camera does great. The photos are, obviously, not going to be the same quality as those that we get from our really nice Nikon with all the different lenses, but I can't take that in the water! For the price, I think this is great. We are very happy with the photo quality. The sound on the video is a little low, but we're only planning on using it when we go down raft water rides and such anyhow, so it doesn't matter to us. I would give this 4.5 stars. The only thing I wish could be changed (I'm not sure that it could be) would be to make the screen easier to see under water. I had to wear goggles to know for sure what I was taking pictures of... or I just had to hold it in the general direction of what I wanted and just go for it. Wearing goggles works though.

Reviews.Title: Newbie
Reviews.Author: New user
Reviews.Content: Battery would not charge! Contacted Olympus and they said they would replace the battery. Took almost 2 months to get the new battery. Luckily I had purchased an extra battery at the time of sale, so I could at least use the camera. Good picture quality, on line manual a pain to use and not the best written or illustrated.

Reviews.Title: absolutely LOVE thiis camera!
Reviews.Author: mrampersad
Reviews.Content: Great price and beautiful quality! ppl are always amazed at its features and how clean the pictures come out. Fantastic choice!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Doug4.7
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera has taken great shots on my trip to Germany. The image stabilization is great for these old shaky hands and low light shooting. I have yet to drop it to test how rugged it is.  It has been rained on and continued working.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: PSBone
Reviews.Content: I bought this here in Manila as it was on sale and I had an upcoming trip to Palawan and was hoping to go island hopping and snorkeling with it. Since I have an Oly SP-720uz, the UI of this was familiar and it was easy for me to use right out of the box. I love the tap to switch shooting modes in too. Very useful I'm sure under water. My first time testing this in water I dunked it in a basin of water my dog bathes in. I kinda panicked when bubbles came out of the lens frame, but I shot a pic, brought it out and it was fine. So when you do use it under water, it'll do this briefly, maybe just letting air out, and you can shoot away. It'll even show a warning message to be sure to check the battery cover is locked well, before using uw (under water).This camera blew me away, I've posted some user pics here too just to show what this little cam is capable of. I never had to worry about it getting banged about and I'm very careful with my electronic stuff. Sadly, I never got to snorkel with it but used it extensively while at the beach, shooting hermit crabs on land and uw, and was just taking very scenic shots with it as the sky that day was sunny/stormy. I'm no photography expert, strictly a point and shoot gal, but for me the IQ just impressed me a lot. The HD video was also amazing! I used this on a Dolphin watching tour and it came out pretty sharp and clear. Battery life is pretty good too, lucky to have my 720uz batt as a spare but I never had to use it and only charged my batt in-camera once. I'm going to be getting a spare batt and charger as I hate the charger it comes in! Why not just provide a separate charger and not have to lug the cables it comes with?My one warning using uw cams that go in and out of the water: beware water spots on the lens, I'll post some pix with this. Be sure to dunk the lens in water and check if there are any when used out of it. Other than that, this little gem is a trooper. I only gave it 4 stars as I wish this had a longer zoom, other than that, no complaints and for an older model, I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a "tough" little companion.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Emma Leblanc
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the olympus stylus cameras!  This new model has some cool new features and much quicker taking photos.  As soon as you snap, its ready for the next picture.  My only complaint is the camera is quite a bit bulkier than previous models.  I would think they would be able to keep it slim.  It barely fits in my camera case.  Oh, one more complaint is the directional toggle.  I like that it's simple and less cluttered on the camera, but the toggle sometimes goes the wrong direction i want it to go.  I am a female with small fingers so i can imagine this would get very frustrating for men.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!!
Reviews.Author: justin palmer
Reviews.Content: The camera is amazing, I have owned some of its predecessors. My only two complaints are the battery life symbol will tell you it is full until it's about to die. But they all have done that exact same thing. Second complaint is in Auto mode in dark situations, sometimes the flash will not go off and you can barely see. If you take the same photo again, it flashes. Strange.This thing takes amazing underwater photos, and very crisp clean shots even when you have had a pot of coffee or two and no food in you . It takes the shot very quickly upon hitting the trigger and will take another super quickly right after!!! No waiting at all.All in all i love the camera. The functions are way better than past configurations and you can pick it up for the first time and know where everything is and go right too it. No hunting or figuring it out.  Screen is nice and big, buttons work easily with big or small fingers and hands.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Alejandro B
Reviews.Content: If you look for a camera for travel in summer this is the camera, remember is point and shoot, resistant, durable and nice auto pics

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: AlexsMom
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera! Be bought it for our son who was deployed to Kuwait, where there is a ton of sand and heat etc.  This will help him capture experience over there.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG820 used
Reviews.Author: Dawn A Maciosek
Reviews.Content: Product delivered as described. I love this camera, beautiful pictures, magic mode, beaty mode, underwater mode, easy to use.Downloaded Olympus veiw finder on line. Would recommend to any one.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my new camera
Reviews.Author: Bruno De P. Ramos
Reviews.Content: Summary: My last camera before this one was a CANON SX200IS and I decided to buy a rugged camera because my two babies. If you are looking for a camera to have fun, bring it to the beach, pool or any other place without too much care with it, it will be your next camera.PROS:1. Image stabilization w/ very fast photos2. 3D picture with dummie interface :p3. Panoram. picture w/ dummie interface... alwsome4. excellent camera for fun5. fast shoots pictures6. very fast sequencial pictures, incredible, must fast then my old canonCONS:1. Image at night is not very good2. When wet you cannot navigate on camera options3. you cannot charge the battery stand alone, you need to connect to the camera4. few pictures w/ a full charge battery

Reviews.Title: Camera is good but has image quality issues
Reviews.Author: V. Challa
Reviews.Content: Lot of people have written detailed reviews which are accurate. I would cut short mine to what I was looking for in this camera. About me, I own a Nikon DSLR with multiple lenses and is my primary camera for pictures. I wanted a camera to take to the beach and swimming pool with my kids without thinking of the consequences.First, the camera does what it is supposed toWaterproof - I tested the camera in a swimming pool and in the ocean multiple times. The water seal seems to hold but ensure that the door locks are in place. Washing the sand off the camera after a beach trip is super easy.Shockproof - My toddler son dropped the camera on hardwood floors, asphalt multiple times and it survived.Freezeproof - I did not get a chance to test it in the New England weather.Pros:The pictures come out amazing at the beach on a clear day with lots of sunlight.The clarity of the LCD is very good.The panaromic feature does a decent job and is super easy to use.Flash is decent at close range and is useless at 5x zoom.Cons:The image quality degrades if the subject is in shadow.Autofocus takes a long time to focus if the kid is water and you are few feet away.Indoor picture quality is not great.Bottomline: If you are going to use this camera only in bright sunlight at a beach or swimming pool then it is a great camera. Do not buy this camera if you are looking for a primary camera to take everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoor activists
Reviews.Author: martian-mart
Reviews.Content: I just replaced my old SW770 with this and it is a great improvement. The HD video is incredible and the photos are vibrant. Having it use the same battery is quite a perk - I have 3 now to choose between.Having just one door for the battery and SD card (another nice upgrade from the XD) is smart but the double-latch buttons open easily on their own - good thing there are two you need to open....All in all, its a great camera for those outdoor activists who never know where they'll be.

Reviews.Title: Dd the job
Reviews.Author: sf
Reviews.Content: This camera worked well on out trip to Belize. No problems with taking or viewing pics. After several attempts on other trips with other cameras, we are pleased with our purchase and would re come this product!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sliannet
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome very fun and user friendly, but buy an extra battery. The battery is terrible! Didn't last very long on Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: My favorite new toy
Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: This camera was absolutely phenomenal. It was worth every penny spent.I spent months researching what camera I wanted to purchase for my upcoming trip to Key West. I also just recently moved to Florida, so I figured having a waterproof camera couldn't hurt. I wanted something that wasn't going to break the bank but would also last longer than a single excursion.After reading countless reviews, it was down to the Canon D20, the Lumix TS4, and the inevitable winner, the Olympus TG-820. While they had comparable specifications, it came down to a very simple feature of the TG-820, it had TWO locks on the SD/battery door. In order to open the door, you have to unlock them in a specific order. This means that any accidental knocks underwater won't open the latch and ruin all your pictures.I haven't bought a camera in roughly 10 years so my expectations for photo quality are probably lower than most people's but with that said, I was extremely satisfied with every picture that was taken. Above water, it was able to capture crisp landscapes and portraits in different lighting settings. I was able to capture some really great panoramic shots. It was easy to use, click once, move the camera (up, down, left, right) and line up the dots.The underwater settings were easy to use after getting used to the control stick that was admittedly a little small. If you're in a well-lit area, (I was at Fort Jefferson of the Dry Tortugas National Park so sunshine was not in short supply), do not use the flash. The light bounces off the particles in the water and obscures the shot. Without it, it's amazingly clear. If I remember, I'll try to post comparison pictures.The startup speed and time to first shot was incredibly quick. I was actually very surprised. I didn't time it but a real-life example was while snorkeling, I would see an awesome fish swim by, turn on the camera, and was able to still capture it without having a high-speed chase soon thereafter.I haven't been able to play around with many of the settings just yet because I only bought it a few weeks ago, but the features that I have experienced, have surpassed my expectations. I cannot wait to go on more adventures with my new camera :)A great accessory is a floatation strap. I bought the "Chums Waterproof camera float (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003CK10DG/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00) It was great to not have to worry about dropping my camera into the reef and losing it or worse, damaging the delicate coral.

Reviews.Title: Great All Around Camera
Reviews.Author: Tony Nichols "Seeker of Ancient Wisdom"
Reviews.Content: I read what the other reviewer said about the battery not lasting long.  I bought 2 of these.  The first one was stolen from me after a week of use and the second one is closely held.  My fully charged battery lasted about 4 hours before needing to be recharged.  I used it during a pool party and the kids went crazy with it shooting underwater videos and jumping into the pool with it.  They even dropped it during filming onto the concrete while running about, no damage to the camera or recording, just a scratch on case, just lucky I guess.Great camera, hope not to lose this one.  It rocks!  Taking it to the beach next week.  I'll see how well it does in sand and sea water.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera!
Reviews.Author: W. Hoyer "bewily"
Reviews.Content: I've been a photographer for many years, having started in 35mm and moving into digital about a decade ago. I'm in awe of what some the today's cameras are capable of.I researched thoroughly this camera's reviews and ratings and compared it to many other cameras. My brother in law owns an older Olympus version which I liked - how easy it was to use, and the underwater capabilities were merely a bonus feature.The TG-820 takes things to a new level. Everything about this camera I like. Vivid, bright, sharp large screen. Quick response in startup and between shots. Incredibly easy to use. Beautiful and feels good in the hand. The stills and video are excellent quality. I've used it in both modes, in and out of water (fresh and ocean) and the results are fabulous.Literally, I have not a single complaint about this camera and recommend it highly to my friends. Even this price is amazing for what you get. I got a 32gb class 10 SDHC to go with it, and that may be partially why the response is so fast. Can't say what other cards would be like, but I can get up to four hours of HD video with my card and who knows how many thousands of still shots in the highest quality mode.Buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Zonia
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our trip to Disney World and our Disney cruise. What a great purchase. We didn't have to worry about it getting wet on water rides. My husband used it underwater in the hotel pool and underwater in the ocean. It took great pictures and video both above water and in water. It has now been on two Disney cruises and survived many underwater experiences and even water rides.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera great pictures
Reviews.Author: Salter
Reviews.Content: This camera was one of the best buys of my life. I bought it for my Honeymoon in Jamaica. I knew I was going to be in the water a lot. My wife and I would wake up walk out to the beach from our suit and spend the day in and out of the water.
