I kept this camera in my swimsuit pocket all day every day in and out of the ocean or the swimming pool. This camera never had a problem. The latch never came open or even seemed like it would. I did this with the camera for 7 days. I took it snorkeling around reefs. I took it ocean kayaking and sailing. I even went cliff diving at Ricks Cafe in Negril and jumped the 25 foot cliff with this camera in my pocket. Nobody else on the tour could take pictures at Ricks because they had to leave their camera on the boat. I just swam right up and snapped a few shots off. So for toughness this camera is a beast. I dont think I could destroy it if I tried. As for picture quality it took some of the best pictures I have ever seen. It takes better pictures than my Cannon Digital Rebel Xti DSLR. The color in the pictures was true to life. Because of this camera I was able to take so many pictures on my Honeymoon that I never would have been able to before. I now have all of the memories forever. If you are thinking of buying this camera for a vacation go for it. It's a cheap price for the lasting memories.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Deal Queen :-)
Reviews.Content: I love my waterproof camera.  I wanted to buy one for my mom, but the price has more than doubled since I bought it last summer :-(  I am not sure why it is so expensive now.  It works great under water and you can take videos under water! I make sure to dry it out any time I use it in the water.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for visits to the beach or watersports
Reviews.Author: Angelo Correia
Reviews.Content: I used this underwater while snorkeling, used it while whitewater rafting, para sailing and many beach visits. Worked great so far. Picture quality is pretty good for the price

Reviews.Title: not so "tough"
Reviews.Author: Peter K Ellis
Reviews.Content: Worked great for about 6 months and then the screen died.  Out of warranty and will cost more to repair than it's worth.

Reviews.Title: NICE!
Reviews.Author: Charles L.
Reviews.Content: Bought for my daughter prior to her first trip to Maui.  Under water clarity is great, no issues with waterproof protection.  We loved it!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I need
Reviews.Author: Joel L. Michel
Reviews.Content: It has a good zoom, a quick touch, and it takes beautiful photos!It's still going strong even after being dropped in the sand, dropped in the lake, dropped in driveway, dropped in the rain, and dropped in the kitchen.It was exactly what I needed after smashing through 3 other digital cameras.It also takes good HD video.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: True to its name
Reviews.Author: Jason E. Comeau "Jason C."
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I took this camera with us on a week long trek into the Grand Canyon to Havasui Falls. It survived the dust, the dirt, the rocks, swimming and diving in the falls, jumping off of the falls, and took great pictures the entire time. If you need a tough camera look no further!

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: BON
Reviews.Content: Just bought it for my goddaughter who is 13 years old and she loves it. Very easy and intuitive menu, pictures are really amazing for such a compact camera, and it's really very solidly built. And the price was really good...

Reviews.Title: So far we have enjoyed this camera
Reviews.Author: Sheilah
Reviews.Content: So far we have enjoyed this camera. Although we have not used the underwater features to take pictures yet, my hubby did fall in the stream while fishing and there have been no issues with the camera. It does take BEAUTIFUL pictures....very clear, great color. My only complaint would be the that controls on the back are WAY to small, even for me and I don't even have sausage fingers.

Reviews.Title: I like it ...
Reviews.Author: Mr. David C. Gough
Reviews.Content: Not too bad ... a little fidgety ... and the quality of the photos is a little grainy ... but overall not a bad happy snap camera that's waterproof and shockproof. The underwater photos are great ... the "on land" photos are pretty good (could be better).

Reviews.Title: It was great while it lasted...
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: I took this camera out and into the water regularly at shallow depths.  It produced great pictures but the toggle button was annoying because it was a joystick that was difficult to control.  This inconvenience was tolerable because the camera offered many cool photo programs and excellent photo quality.  Unfortunately, the fun only lasted a year before the screen inexplicably failed to show a picture.  The camera is now essentially useless as a digital camera because without the screen, you have no control over what will be caught by the camera or utilization of the different photo programs.  It's like taking a picture with an old-school camera that requires developing film only worse because you don't have a viewfinder to target the shot.  The camera still looks new and never leaked or sustained any damage from taking it to the beach or splashing in the surf in warm waters or near freezing.  I would have rated it a solid 4 stars before it crapped out on me for no apparent reason just outside the warranty period.  I liked this Olympus tough model better than an older version I owned because pictures came out so much better.  I just bought a newest tough model but was sure to purchase an extended warranty this time around.

Reviews.Title: Quality pics and video
Reviews.Author: SavedGasman27
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute buy because my wife decided that she wanted a waterproof camera about a week before we went to Cancun. This is a good quality camera. I'm glad I chose this one for her.

Reviews.Title: Great Sturdy Camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl J
Reviews.Content: At times too many choices but it is sturdy and my husband uses it on the job site so the toughness really helps.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Visual8
Reviews.Content: I've not found a single negative point in this camera. I gave 4 stars because it seems that the built-in flash is a little way too shinny (automatic function)... Generates a lot of shadows. Though that's not a negative thing at all, it does bother me a little bit.

Reviews.Title: good camera, good battery life
Reviews.Author: geosupergeek
Reviews.Content: I bought this for work as I needed something that was water proof. It works well and handles going through the shower/decon without problem. It has a fairly wide angle lens which is perfect for my uses. Only zoom is digital, so that could be limiting for some people. Overall a good waterproof camera--rated to 33 ft (static), so I wouldn't take it snorkeling more than 10 feet or so as with dynamic movements I'd expect the seal to go. It spends most of its time on my desk and takes 10 or so pictures a week. Only needed to  charge it twice in 4 months, so good battery life.It does have an attachment in the box to plug into the wall for charging or can also be plugged into usb port for charging. Not sure if pics will trasfer via cable---I take the card out and plug it directly into my computer to download pics.

Reviews.Title: Great quality at a great price, Good Vacation camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Greenleaf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going on a caribbean cruise (our first!) and had signed up for a swim with the sea turtle snorkeling outing.  I wanted to be able to take underwater pictures, but wasn't keen on one of those disposable cameras, so I picked this up a few weeks before our trip.  I was really thrilled at how well it worked, and how great the zoom and picture quality was.I purchased a floatation wrist strap to compliment this which was a perfect accessory.  It took great picts, and video both above and below the water.  We were in about 20 - 25 feet of water and I could see the sea turtles and a manta ray swimming along the bottom, and was able to zoom in with clarity that produced unbelievable quality imagesMy one complaint and reason for four stars instead of five is that it was too easy to switch between still picts and video.  I'd inadvertantly switched to video, and then couldn't figure out why it "wasn't working" (only to later realize it was, but had just been taking video, not stills!).  At one point, I took a great half above, half below the surface photo of my husband  I went to hand him the camera to take a picture of me, and in the process of handing it over, had flipped it to video without realizing it.  He couldn't figure out why he couldn't take a picture and handed it back.  (I have to admit the ensuing video was hilarious, watching myself bob up and down, spitting out salty water saying "Did you take it?" and smiling interchangeably).Great buy for the money, I was very pleased with this camera.  I will be putting it on the motorcycle this summer for vacation pictures on the bike too.

Reviews.Title: Drains battery very quickly
Reviews.Author: Mario Uy "JustMyOpinion"
Reviews.Content: Pros:I have used this around water based activities and underwater several times...no problem.Picture and video quality above water:  Good like most other point and shoot cameras.Cons:The camera consumes a lot of power.  I have 2 spare and 1 original batteries.  All batteries last about the same....so it's not the battery.  It's the camera.  And there is no warning...it goes to down to 2 bars and then it's out cold after a few more shots.  I carry a spare battery all the time.Picture and video quality underwater: Poor...i think it's because it does not focus well underwater if water is slightly turbid.  This is definitely not for underwater photography.Overall:I like this camera because I can use it safely around water based activities or when it's raining.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Quackers "Quackers"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few weeks and it's great.  The shutter speed is super fast for a casual/novice like myself.  I recommend getting a decent memory card too.  I haven't had it submerged yet, but the previous Olympus I owned lasted for 2 years before losing some of it's ability to remain dry (lens would fog after keeping submerged for extended periods).  It's a little bulky but hey I can't complain.  I'll update this if the camera ends up leaking.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Kim Colwell "Shambhalla"
Reviews.Content: I am a sucker for fun ways to take shots such as going under water and using various filters. I considered the newer cameras in the same series, but the picture quality seemed to be the best on this one. I have loved playing with it without the fear of breaking it with my clutsy ways. I can drop it or dunk it in water with no worries at all.

Reviews.Title: good camera - under water
Reviews.Author: Hongjian Lu "al"
Reviews.Content: I took picture and video with it for under water activity. It turned out with nice quality pictures. The battery lasted just as long as we needed.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater!
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Monroe
Reviews.Content: This worked great for us taking underwater photos of rays near the beach and fish while we scuba dived for the first time in Australia.  We have used it three times underwater so far without incident. We followed all of the instructions to keep it clean and sealed.  The pictures look great and we were very pleased.  Works great on the enhancement settings when shooting out of the water as well.  A tip for shooting underwater, don't use flash if you can avoid it, you will quickly discover that the ocean is full of tiny particles that show up in the light of the flash.

Reviews.Title: broken after a few months
Reviews.Author: Brittany vanschaick
Reviews.Content: we bought this camera before a trip to the Bahamas and it took beautiful pictures. One day the screen stopped turning on and white lines flickered across it. we have had this camera for 6 months now and it does not work. luckily Olympus has a 1 year warranty and we are going to send it in for a repair.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to go on our honeymoon, its great! it takes clear beautiful pictures. its rugged, thank goodness!! I drop everything and this can handle me.

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-820 12MP Shock/Water/Freeze-Proof Camera-Red V104060RU000
Reviews.Author: Hh
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great when I first got it but it no longer takes pictures. It turns on but I can't change any settings or take pictures. It was never used in an underwater capacity, however it did get wet. Purchased July 2013 stopped working December 2013

Reviews.Title: Good Quality and convenient
Reviews.Author: Ariya Momeny
Reviews.Content: I like the product. Handy, stable with good quality picture. The flash is not doing a very good job but Definitely recommended it.

Reviews.Title: I really like it
Reviews.Author: Whitney
Reviews.Content: The underwater pics are so very cool.  I took this little guy with me on a snorkeling trip in costa rica and took video with it underwater.  You can see the fish pretty clearly and hear the water.  Underwater video/pictures = a 10/10.  The only reason Im docking this a star is because for "normal" pictures.  They look really great on the camera, but when you blow them up on a computer, you can tell they arent as sharp.  But, all in all, I love this tough little camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Pete Caravas
Reviews.Content: After extensively researching "tough" point and shoot cameras, I decided to go with Olympus' Tough series and I am very pleased with my decision. The TG-820 has a sturdy, rugged feel, but isn't bulky. It has tons of features and a great design. Picture quality is good and the menus are very intuitive. A great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: It's really Tough
Reviews.Author: Katrina Mata
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my boyfriend – we were doing some traveling in 2014 so I needed something we can take cliff diving, snowboarding and into the jungles of Cambodia. So far it’s lasted the test of cliff diving in Mexico – the resolution is not amazing at night but for what we need it to do it works great. We took it on a muddy ATV ride and the pictures came out great and really captured the rugged roads. We also have some sweet underwater pictures. I read issues with battery life, but ours lasted two days, one day with extensive shooting. My boyfriend loved the features on it as well, including the rapid shots for when we were cliff diving. I did drop it which caused a scratch to the back screen, but nothing too bad. It’s a great tough camera that we can throw in our day pack and just go!

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-820 12MP Shock/Water/Freeze-Proof Camera-Red V104060RU000
Reviews.Author: Richard Ringwalt
Reviews.Content: I had a Olympus Stylus 7000 and it performed excellent however I needed a wide angle lens and theOlympus Tough is what the doctor ordered..

Reviews.Title: Such a great camera
Reviews.Author: Nicole McDowell
Reviews.Content: Took this on vacation with us.  Got some incredible underwater shots.  So nice to be able to go out on the ocean and not have to worry about the camera.

Reviews.Title: Dead after a year. Settings get changed by accident easily.
Reviews.Author: Cindy H.
Reviews.Content: I bought this a little over a year ago for our annual Christmas vacation to Hawaii. So we've used it last winter break, this past summer, and this past winter break. Suddenly during our last winter vacation, it died for no reason. I was swimming in the ocean and taking some pictures and suddenly it just died. The battery was recharged the night before. I tried replacing the battery (I have two batteries) when we got back to the hotel, still wouldn't work. I don't know how I can get it fixed, I didn't even bother getting a warranty since the product got such positive reviews.When it did work, it took pictures fine. I would have give it 3 stars if it didn't die. My number one annoyance with this camera is that the controls / menu options are so easy to push by accident. So if I'm swimming in the ocean with a lot of glare from the sun I can't see the screen much and I usually just point the camera to the fish and whatever I want to take a picture of. It's so easy to press the menu options by accident and the options get changed by accident as a result, and sometimes it made me wonder why my pictures looked blue (it accidentally changed to some setting, I don't even know).I do not recommend this product. I don't know what else is out there (I'm going to have to research for a new one) but I just know this one was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Great pics!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife. She absolutely loves it. Takes great pics. Waiting for warmer weather to try out the waterproof feature.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the $$.
Reviews.Author: R. King
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now since summer 2013...It's built like a tank so you can take it virtually anywhere in any type of weather/situation.Battery life is excellent and can take a ton of pics before needing to recharge (depending on your settings of course).The pictures it takes are great and comes with many built-in features to enhance the shooters chance for a great picture.I've noted a few things that I'm not so happy with - but I can live with them:The lens is located in a place where my fingers gets in the field of view depending on how I hold the camera for the shot... I use a small tripod attached to the bottom as a handle to eliminate this problem for me mostly.The movie mode isn't all that great - image blurs when panning (auto focusing?)... Movies are good when you keep camera still using a tripod... Might just be that I haven't used/adjusted the movie-mode all that much.I haven't used the camera underwater yet, but have used it in pretty nasty weather without incident.The operating buttons on the back of the camera are a bit small and it takes awhile to get used to using them - Can use them now with no problem.Overall - It's an easy camera to setup, use anywhere and takes excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Baldwin
Reviews.Content: I used this camera on our trip to Maui.  I was equally impressed with both land and underwater shots.  My only complaint would be that sometimes it did not take a good second shot (blurry).  The floating strap that came with it was a piece of garbage and I'm glad I didn't rely on it, especially underwater.  I appreciated all the extras that came in the package deal, but wish the camera case was a little bigger so I could have everything in one bag.  Overall, impressed with camera, but not everything in the package.

Reviews.Title: very awesome underwater camera
Reviews.Author: RedBeard
Reviews.Content: We used this camera on our honeymoon snorkeling in Cozumel. We used it everyday for 2 weeks. Never had any issues at all. Water seal is very nice and tight. Does not feel like the seal will ever be an issue. Battery life is very good as well. We used the camera quite often throughout the day and only charged it twice a week, before all day adventures. Powers on very quick. I would normally swim with it off and only turn it on when I saw something I wanted to take a picture of. Takes pictures pretty quick too so that is nice. I would guess about 3-5 seconds between turning the power on and have taken the first picture. This works really nice underwater when some fish don't want to be photographed. Flash work really well underwater as well. We have not yet tested, purposely or accidental, the shock rating. Controls are very nice and easy to use on land and underwater. Pictures turned out amazing too. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a tough camera and/or snorkeling camera.

Reviews.Title: Quality pictures for quality picture memories
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus Digital Camera TG-820 for my Daughter-In-Law to take picture of our first Grand Daughter !She loves the camera with all the various settings and functions. The picture quality is excellent and she will be taking beautiful photo memories for years to come. Thank you for making our gift giving so easy with prompt delivery from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome camera so far
Reviews.Author: Laura K. English "laurae68"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for swim meets, our trip to Hawaii, Montana, etc.  I haven't got to use it for those things yet, but the pictures I have used it for are awesome.  I am very happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent images, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Gates
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 6 months now and used it almost daily. I'm not going to claim any photography knowledge or prowess, but I take a plethora of pictures of everyday stuff-family, pets, silly things around town. I love that this camera is so simple to use, with all kinds of options for image manipulation. I've never used it underwater, but I've taken it kayaking with me several times. I put a big memory card in it, and I've used it for taking lots of videos. Uploading is fast and easy. The battery has an excellent lifespan. The delay between pressing the button and taking a photo is very nominal compared to other cameras I've used. The display is crystal-clear. I'm impressed with the panorama function (though it is slightly slow to assemble an image after you take the component photos, you rarely snap a panorama in a hurry), and the other SCENE options make for some fun photos. I also like the "Beauty Fix" and "Shadow Adjust" editing functions--you can practically photoshop your pictures to perfection yourself! I can't say enough good things about this camera. Very, very pleased with this purchase and would buy it again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: Bought for backpacking
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Bought this for backpacking, as we need an extremely durable camera to take pictures with. We haven't had a chance to use it, so I will update this after our next trip. Just playing with it in the house, it is a wonderful camera. It takes clear, gorgeous pictures, and has a ton of shooting modes. The only one that we had trouble with was the cat recognition mode - it's supposed to automatically take a picture of a cat's face when it's detected, but it didn't. Not a major complaint, I probably wouldn't use this mode anyway, it was just fun to test it. Overall, so far, an awesome investment.

Reviews.Title: this thing is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Jeff A.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife for her birthday and she LOVES IT!! I don't think she's takin' it in to water but the picture quality is really good

Reviews.Title: Great underwater
Reviews.Author: hilphillips
Reviews.Content: The first time I jumped in the water with this camera, I worried I would fry it as soon as it touched the water. (Probably had one too many experiences with phones + water.) Pleasantly surprised that didn't happen, I really enjoyed getting to use the camera underwater. The flash works underwater, and I was able to take some great photos.My only issue was that "above water" the camera sometimes had a difficult time taking clear, non-bleary photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: shoppaholic_me
Reviews.Content: Love this! This is my 2nd olympus tough camera, an upgrade from my first olympus. Would highly recommend this to anyone who loves the outdoor. Seller ships fast.

Reviews.Title: Good camera especailly for taking pictures during outdoor/in winter/in the water activities.
Reviews.Author: Peter1971
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for outdoor. You don't have to be afraid that it will get wet or if you accidentally drop it. During last vacation I took some pictures underwater and when swimming in the sea. There only one thing to remember that every time when you take camera to make picture in sea water then after that just flash with fresh water to avoid corrosion.There is a lot of themes in auto mode (panorama, sport, night, underwater etc.) which make it easy for average user to shoot good picture without playing with manual adjustment. However, if you want to adjust exposition, ISO or some other parameters you can still do it.This camera is also good to shoot pictures in the winter time outside. I would highly recommend it for active people and also for kids - after initial setup with parents help only what they have to do is just take camera and start taking pictures. Big screen allow to check pictures and see if results are as you want it.Another advantage is that it use SD card which is most common type and also SDHC card - they are not expensive and can be use in other equipments/electronics. I use with it SanDisk Ultra 16GB SDHC 30MB/s card and it is fast enough to record pictures even if you are shooting series of pictures in sport mode.Both battery compartment and ports are well protected with the cover which have locks to prevent open this compartment unintentionally for example in the water.Pictures are sharp, clear and size can be adjusted in the main menu. Of course higher quality (bigger size of the picture) is better if you want to coorect picture with some programs. But still you can reduce size to be reasonable and be able to save more pictures on the memory card.In the menu picture size dimension can be choose as well. Flash can be easy switch off/on or set in auto mode, makro mode also available as well as red eye reduction which is working surprisingly good for compact camera - made few pictures inside, druing evening and now one on the picture had red eyes. Of course it is also a little bit matter of trying and testing but generally is working good.Forgot to add before. It is my second camera Olympus Tough series. First one T8000 which I bought 5 years ago is still working perfect, taking good quality, sharp pictures. My teenage sone use it a lot and there was no single problem. This is one of the reasons why I decided to go for another Olympus Tough for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: Good budget underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Hafs "Hafs"
Reviews.Content: very good quality camera. Takes good pictures underwater and also take very good pictures on dry land when the camera is dry which i was suprised about

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Spencer "Spencer"
Reviews.Content: We've played around with a few underwater cameras, and this was is outstanding.  Takes great photos & video.  Easy to use.  Not disappointed at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Bone
Reviews.Content: Easy to use with beautiful pictures. Very durable. Recently took it on a vacation to California and I loved that I could take pics and video of my kids playing in the ocean for the first time and not worry about dropping my camera in the water.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera! Great underwater! Take it on all our vacations in the summer and winter. I have not had any problems and pics come out great!

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-820 Silver camera
Reviews.Author: V. Mclean "cardmaking"
Reviews.Content: This takes great pictures and easy to use. Many setting for different situations. It's waterproof but I haven't tried that.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Beach & Scuba Diving - 55ft DEEP
Reviews.Author: HSI | IT Company
Reviews.Content: This camera has been amazing.  I have used it on the beach, at night, and scuba diving.  Being an IT geek, I always expect products to work less then advertised.  This has gone beyond what was expected.  The pictures and videos are great and I went 55 ft deep with the camera.  When I was that deep all of the buttons didn't respond because the spring wasn't strong enough, but when I returned to a better depth they all started to work again.

Reviews.Title: Superb Camera For Anyone
Reviews.Author: Dr. Dan Golden
Reviews.Content: I've been an amateur photographer for more than 50 years using equipment ranging from a Kodak box camera, 4X5 speed graphic, multiple SLR's , point and shot film/digital with the latest being an Olympus SLR multiple lens digital.  This one was purchased to be used on an upcoming cruise to the Caribbean.  I was looking for something offering more than the point and shoot but not as bulky to carry around as my SLR. When it arrived I was not disappointed.I have taken over a 100 pre-cruise shots as well as very short duration video.  I am extremely pleased with the results, the ease of navigation through the menu and its size.  The only thing I had a little trouble getting used to was the small joy stick.  I would highly recommend this camera to be used for virtually any setting.  I would also recommend printing the manual from the CD for easy reference.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Larry waldrip
Reviews.Content: This is a great all around camera. Bought it to take on a cruise and was not disappointed it works well both in the dark venues of the ship and the bright sunlight of the beach

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Cannon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise I was going on in April. One of the activities I was doing was snuba which goes down about 20 feet. I wanted to be able to take pictures of the reef but wanted something with better quality than the disposable underwater cameras. This worked great! I have awesome pictures and a video from the dive. Since then I have used this camera on hiking trips and have never worried about breaking it and am always pleased with the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted in a small and durable package
Reviews.Author: C. J. Fairhurst "Cathy F"
Reviews.Content: I had an old Olympus (pre-Tough) waterproof camera that died after about 5 years and replaced it with a Panasonic Lumix TS20.  I was not happy with the picture quality and finally traded it back in after one year and bought this little gem.  I haven't done much underwater yet but I'm very happy with the quality of my snapshots from a recent Hawaii vacation.It has some great new functions: panoramic, burst shooting and much more I haven't tried yet.

Reviews.Title: Some great shots
Reviews.Author: k1234
Reviews.Content: Took this on our recent holiday to Lanai Hawaii, it worked great, easy to use. The water and land shots all turned out great.

Reviews.Title: A perfect fit for my family
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this camera.  I have owned three Olympus digital cameras and each one gets so much better than the last.  As a family we enjoy a multitude of outdoor activities.  Most recently we hiked through heavy rains, went canoeing and ran messy 5K races.  This camera survived it all and captured some incredible memories for us.  My children (ages 5 and 3) have also shown an interest in photography, and most children's cameras are less than stellar in regards to functionality.  I can be confident in letting them practice with this one without me constantly having to worry about its destruction.  Like most Olympus models, there is no instruction manual, but I find that I learn the most simply by testing out the settings myself.  It tends to be a little heavy, as well, but I consider it a minor inconvenience compared to its durability, increased speed and sharpness, and easy video features.  A must have for active families!

Reviews.Title: Super stoked!
Reviews.Author: Beachcomber
Reviews.Content: I was super stoked with this camera when I received it. It is was in perfect condition when I received it. I have used it several times already and the pictures look great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: Roy L. Shockey
Reviews.Content: We bought this to take with us on a cruise as we didn't feel like lugging a huge Nikon with extra lens thru the jungle and climbing Mayan pyramids.  Works great and definitely feel bulletproof.  One thing I would inform people about is that you have to open the battery/sd card door in order to attach the charging cord.  This is obviously done so that the waterproof integrity around the door can be maintained.  Also, this camera takes its own special battery and cannot accept AA batteries.  My first purchase (also on Amazon) was to buy a little kit that came with an extra battery, a wall charger w/ travel adaptors, and other useful bits.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: I lost the little camera I carry with me skiing, mountain biking and hiking and bought this based on some very positive reviews I found. Great photos, fun artisitc setting, easy to use and great price.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and sturdy camera
Reviews.Author: JAB
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take into the pool to get some fun shots with my kids.  The pictures are great and there are no worries about water, sand, mud, rain...  I have use this camera underwater at about 5 ft, on the beach and had it covered with sand, and at the kids soccer games where it performed wonderfully.  It may not take the place of a more expensive camera where there is no fear of the elements but to have a camera for the events above it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great!
Reviews.Author: David Tegreene
Reviews.Content: I've used it on land, on sea, and in sea.  The results are all the same.....great pictures and great videos.

Reviews.Title: Tough camera but weak battery/charger
Reviews.Author: J. Hong
Reviews.Content: The Olympus TG-820 met my expectations as a sports camera. It is rugged and versatile. However, the battery does not last more than 5-6 hours of use whether the power-save mode is used  or not. Also, the charging system takes almost the same amount of time to fully charge the battery. Together with the limitation that the camera cannot be used during battery charge, this is a severe limitation.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: P. Meilhac
Reviews.Content: The camera is working perfectly as always when you get an Olympus.  It has been used a lot and is used for a business.  Therefore it is a great camera that you can use for every day photography or special occasions.

Reviews.Title: Amazing product
Reviews.Author: R. Ioffe "yan ioffe"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for Jamaica vacation and was not disappointed. Great quality shots, very reliable. I took it on several snorkeling trips where it was submerged for several hours (3-10 feet depth) without a problem. Dropped it a few times, banged it on the rock - no problem either.

Reviews.Title: great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: happy customer
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations. My kids have a blast with this in the pool and it's very easy to use

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome.
Reviews.Author: Willis Ng
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and took it with me and my kids down to the water at our swimming pool, then took some pictures and videos of the kids, they all come out from average to good. Most importantly, we did have fun time with the camera while being in the water, kids love to make it more creative then check out how they look in the pictures.Very nice camera with all those features at the decent price, definitely would recommend, especially for underwater.One thing I notice is the battery drains half way after every time I use, which seems to be not very good comparing to most other cameras. Probably because the battery is too small and doesn't hold much.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures.
Reviews.Author: Douglas K. Bergman
Reviews.Content: I used this camera on my last trip to Hawaii. I took many underwater pictures and made numerous videos. I loved it!!! No problems what so ever. I bought the Olympus Foam Float Strap as well. The strap will float the camera if need be. Be sure to select the underwater mode when using for best results. On land this camera performed well both for photo taking and movie making.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Natalia
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camera to two trips already. I love how fast it is, the picture quality is great both in and out of the water. I have short several videos going down water slides and they are great too. When water gets in on the microphone though it distorts the sound a lot. My friends enjoyed it too when I brought his to a pool party, everyone was taking underwater pictures. I'm really happy I got this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mdeivy
Reviews.Content: This camera has been in the ocean, the pool, Texas heat and dropped several times due to the kids wanting to take their own pictures. Photo quality is very good. Easy to use. Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: renee b.
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. Takes beautiful pictures, very high quality. Some reviews that I have read stated the battery didn't last long. Well, I bought 2 just in case, and I just returned from a 12 day trip and changed my battery once. Not because it was dead either. I changed it at half full just to be safe. I probably didn't even have to. You don't ever have to worry about this camera getting wet or dropping it. its light weight and fits into even the smallest purse. The feature that allows you to take a series of pictures simultaneously, is fantastic for moving subjects. It then allows you to look at them one by one and delete the bad ones. Overall, this camera it worth every penny and then some!

Reviews.Title: Olympus Tough
Reviews.Author: candi
Reviews.Content: Love that it can go underwater and on the beach with no worries, and love, love, love the built in special effects (especially dramatic!) that are super easy to use. Great camera at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This is a great rugged point and shoot camera. It takes amazing close ups. and pretty good with full zoom. I would not throw away my DSLR camera but this is a fine companion for rugged trips, rainy weather or anyplace else you don't dare take a $1000 camera. I use this camera more than my "Big" camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Stern
Reviews.Content: I'm super satisfied with this. I haven't taken it completely underwater yet, but it survived getting wet in a canoe. Also, I've dropped it once or twice and it's held up. The pictures are pretty clear. The battery lasts a full day of using it. There are many different settings available, I haven't figured them all out yet.

Reviews.Title: Durable, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Erin Phinney
Reviews.Content: I love how easy it is to get shots of anything we want without having to worry about getting the camera wet or possibly dropping it. But, I'm not as impressed by the auto feature that selects which type of picture I'm trying to take as I was with my non-waterproof camera (that got dropped in the river on a backpacking trip). I need to do more manual selection with this one, so it takes a little more time, but it's not difficult. More frustrating is how easy it is for the on button to get pushed when the camera is packed away. Twice on a backpacking trip I heard the camera turn on as I packing it into a pocket and a handful of times I heard that happen as I was stuffing it into my PFD on a rafting trip. A rugged camera will get stuffed into small spaces, so it doesn't make sense that it's so easy to turn on, especially given that it doesn't have a fabulous battery life.

Reviews.Title: Well done again, Olympus
Reviews.Author: Danilo F. Krizman
Reviews.Content: Buttons could be placed better and shaped to be easer distinguished. The zoom button is too close to the neighbor button. But all this are small things as the rest is good or very good or even excellent. It is very quick camera (CMOS sensor). I love it with 4,5 stars

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: noname21
Reviews.Content: Takes good picture and easy to use. Used it on a 2 1/2 week bike trip and still had pleny of battery left. I need to read the manual now to learn more about it but very please at pictures to date.

Reviews.Title: It certainly seems Tough enough.
Reviews.Author: Robert V
Reviews.Content: This little camera seems to live up to its name, but its underwater performance remains to be seen.  I bought it in advance of a trip to the Galapagos Islands, but that's a few months away.  With the limited "dry" use that I've tried, I have been very pleased with its performance.  I am an Olympus fan and my "big" camera is an E-3 with several SHG lenses.  The menu system of this little camera is simple and intuitive.  It has a great feel and is well built.  So far so good!  More to come "post" trip.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I'm still figuring out all the stuff it can do but all the normal camera functions are easy enough you can take it out of the box and just start taking pics. Takes great clear pictures! My four year old Loves taking pictures do its nice to let him go take pics and not worry about him dropping and breaking it!

Reviews.Title: VERY TOUGH!!!!
Reviews.Author: James' Mommy "Hotmomma"
Reviews.Content: My husband love his tough camera. This camera is great and my husband dropped it and and do whatever and still alive lol.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Needed
Reviews.Author: Shoppinmommy
Reviews.Content: This camera has it all - video and multi-functional picture taking.  From the previous reviews that I read, I was a bit intimated by all of the features.  The hardest thing to learn was the initial setup on the date and time.  I have already put it to the test by dropping it and it still works great!

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: Erek Burek
Reviews.Content: Works great. Easy to use. Good battery life. Sometimes would get battery low, then wait a little bit and battery life is good, not sure what that is.  Takes great pictures. Better than my old 16no camera. Great auto focus and stable control, never got a blurry picture even with Ashley hands. Saves settings, old camera had to set it up every time power on. Would use it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew T Clement
Reviews.Content: I expected this camera to be rugged, durable and functional. What I didn't expect was the easily accessible controls, intuitive interface and quality filters. I bought this bad boy to take with me on hiking excursions and managed to get much better picture quality than I expected. My only complaint is the lack of a viewfinder but those have disappeared on most consumer grade digital cameras.I put the camera through its paces on a canyoneering trip, during which it was soaked, banged on rocks and still performed like a champ.I recommend this camera without reservations, especially at the $210 price point that I managed to snag it.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Celeste B. Marcks
Reviews.Content: I used this for a trip to Stockholm and had no problems.  Photos look great and it was easy to use.  Can't wait to try it out underwater.  So far, have not tested the shock proofing... but it is just a matter of time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for tough conditions!
Reviews.Author: Cleta Polk
Reviews.Content: I have tried many Olympus 'Tough' camera versions through the years for adventure trips without fear of hurting my camera, and they just keep getting better!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kris C. Reinecke "Kindle Krazy"
Reviews.Content: Takes wonderful pictures.  You can drop it into a puddle of water and not worry.  Fits in my pocket.  Movies taken from this camera are first class.  No fuzziness when displayed on a 56 inch TV screen.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the beach.
Reviews.Author: Robert C. LaFrance
Reviews.Content: This is a great little all weather, shock resistant camera for the price.  I used it in salt water and at the near by campsite with no problems.I did not not give it five stars because the button layout is a little awkward and small. The zoom button is just just weird, it's more like a switch.  Also, the charging station has a plug in that feels like it should push in farther but stick outs.  Other than those design issues this camera is durable and easy to use. Just don't expect high end features with a small waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice upgrade
Reviews.Author: E. Michael Calnan
Reviews.Content: I decided to replace my old Olympus Stylus after noting the picture and video quality had fallen far behind what was currently available.  I wanted to stay with Olympus and with a camera that was waterproof as I use cameras in wet environments - on boats, hiking in the rain, and skiing in a snowstorm.  The TG-820 is very easy to use - especially for video.  There is no need to turn a "mode" button anymore.  There is a separate button that starts video recording that uses the standard red arrow icon.  The pictures are sharp with much faster shutter times and storage speeds.  The video and sound are awesome and with a 32G SDHC card I don't worry about running out of storage.  The only downsides are its size and weight - bigger and heavier than the Stylus - and the inability to force the flash while leaving everything else in auto mode.  Maybe there is a way to work around the flash issue.

Reviews.Title: I own 8 of these
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I uses these for my business by taking picures of greasy hoods and fans of restaurants. They are not indestructable. I always send them back to be repaired because they do break. The warranty is one year so if you intend to keep it seberal years get the warranty. We use they harder than the casual user. I have not found any other camera that is better than this so we will continue to use them until soemthing better comes out.

Reviews.Title: Excellent construction and works as advertized
Reviews.Author: L. Samuelson "Pool-Deck-Mom"
Reviews.Content: This TG-820 replaced an older Olympus 810.  We are a watersport family, and this digital camera allows us to take pictures almost anywhere we are on top of the water or under it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ben Holt
Reviews.Content: This is my first Olympus camera after owning three Canons.  I got my first digital camera back in 2006, which was a Canon SD 600.  It took great pictures and was solid as a rock until I dopped it and it broke.  My next camera was a Canon SD 1000, which lasted two weeks before the lens stopped moving and Canon refused to fix it under warranty.  Next, I got a Canon SD 780 IS which was thin and looked awesome, but was poorly sealed and kept getting dust inside the lens.  Canon paid for the first two repairs, but then when it got dirty a third and final time, the one-year warranty had ended so I decided to just go with a different brand.That's when I got the Olympus Tough TG-820 after reading some online reviews.  This camera surpasses all of my expectations.  It is exceptionally well-built and pleasing to hold.  When powering on and off, the metal lens cover opens and closes with an immensely satisfying, high-quality "click."  I took it to Hawaii for a week, where I took hundreds of underwater photos and videos per day without a problem.  The single joystick control is very easy to use one-handed while underwater.  While reading the reviews, I was worried that image quality might be compromised in exchange for being waterproof, but this camera takes better-looking photos than any other camera I've owned.  All my friends are jealous of the quality of my photos.  Take 16:9 photos and put them on an HDTV to exploit the truly stunning image quality.  There are manual controls as well as separate modes for underwater, landscape, indoor, etc.  I usually leave it in "intelligent automatic" mode, which chooses the appropriate mode.  There's a panoramic mode that automatically stitches together shots, which is perfect for mountaintop views.  There is also a "magic" filter, which is fun to play with and takes sweet-looking shots that look photoshopped.After owning fragile Canons for so long, it's nice not having to worry about getting my camera dirty or wet.  If you need a go-anywhere, do-everything camera for your active lifestyle, then look no further.Note: A spare battery is essential if you plan to go on a trip and take pictures all day.Note: I bought this Olympus Neoprene Soft Digital Camera Case,http://www.amazon.com/Olympus-Neoprene-Soft-Digital-Camera/dp/B000JFH982/ref=pd_bxgy_p_img_yas Amazon suggested, but it was way too small.  If you want a case, get a bigger one.

Reviews.Title: Good Pocket Camera!
Reviews.Author: stefanie bartley
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as an alternative to my DSLR for occasions when I don't want to worry about breaking my nice camera, but I still want to have something a little better than my cell phone to record memories!  I took this skiing with me and it worked great.  If its cold out, make sure the batteries are fully charged, but that's the same with most electronics.  The camera has a lot of pre-set options (i.e. snow, fireworks, party, etc), but there's also a lot of manual control settings that you can set yourself.  This camera is basically what I expected out of a camera of this type - its not going to replace my DSLR, but its going to be a nice addition to my photography gear.  I'm looking forward to trying it during snorkeling or scuba diving (not too deep) at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Ms. NC
Reviews.Content: Brought for a christmas present and my daughter loved it, no problems so far.  She wanted a camera she could take to the ocean and not worry about it getting wet  while on the water.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures, is reliable, fast, and waterproof
Reviews.Author: Jmatt
Reviews.Content: The shutter speed is great, it takes very good pictures.  I might not be happy if I were a professional photographer, but I'm just a regular person and am very happy.  I got some VERY nice night pictures of fireworks, the moon, and lightning from the top of a mountain on the 4th of July; a once-in-a-lifetime experience and I have the pictures to show for it.The battery life is good, but you'll probably want a second battery as a backup.Edit 4-5-2014:Both the original and the backup battery I bought have since died. Both abruptly quit taking a charge.However, the important thing is that the camera is still working great. It has survived multiple trips to the beach in Maine, ponds, rivers, Christmas, birthday parties, hikes, and daily travel my wife's purse. Other than the lcd screen getting gouged from being loose in the purse we have not had any problems (and a neoprene sleeve stopped the purse damage.Still very happy.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Dorothy D. Burns "Dottie"
Reviews.Content: Got it for my daughter for Christmas after she sunk her other one in the bottom of a lake.  She is really thrilled that she can now take pictures of her kids at swim lessons and when just playing in the water.  Also got her the floating strap so this one won't end up in the bottom on a lake.

Reviews.Title: One tough camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Black "Tundra Owner"
Reviews.Content: We use this camera during boating season in conjunction with the floating foam strap and they are a wonderful addition. We recently took this camera with us to New Zealand and Australia and it worked very well in the Great Barrier reef and in the glacial waters in New Zealand. One of the dependable and functional camera's I have ever used.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Silke  Easom
Reviews.Content: I had this camera now for 2 weeks and use it almost every day and I just love it. The camera is very easy to use and the different settings are great. Couldn't have bought me a better small camera.I take lots of pictures when I am out bird hunting. So I needed a small, rugged camera that takes pictures quick with a decent quality and it's exactly what I was hoping for. I am the kind of person that doesn't like to read directions and that doesn't really know anything about cameras but wants to have nice pictures and this is the perfect camera for me.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Shane Osborn
Reviews.Content: I tested a lot of these point-and-shoot cameras before buying this one. Pictures always come out clear. Picture taking is MUCH faster than other cameras in the class. Plus it's waterproof. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift for son
Reviews.Author: Ronald Konieczynski "Ron K"
Reviews.Content: My son sails a small and "wet " sailboat and crews on a large racing sailboat.  Neither boat is camera friendly--the small one dunks him often and the big one sails in all kinds of weather.  This camera can fit in the life vest pocket--get wet--get banged around--and still survive.  It's perfect foer his lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: John A. Denny "Jack"

Reviews.Content: Great little point and shoot camera. Take pictures quite quickly which is good for taking pictures of the kids and dog. We haven't really tested the toughness yet, but nice to know that you don't have to treat it really gently.

Reviews.Title: A winner

Reviews.Content: i love this camera, i've dropped it several times as well as my 2 year old and it barely has a scratch on it. it's a beautiful camera

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Collette H. Johns
Reviews.Content: if you travel, or have kids this camera is great you don't have to worry about it getting damaged great for swimming or any activity....

Reviews.Title: Great camera for what it designed for. Very good picture quality.
Reviews.Author: K. Nguyen "DK"
Reviews.Content: The TG-820 is great water/shock/freeze/dust..proof camera.  The image quality is very good and feel very snappy and fast.  As of July/August 2012, I think it's the best bang for the buck waterproof camera ($250-300) It takes stunning images under and above water. I'm highting some pros and cons:Pluses:- Great image quality under/above water.- Very fast on powering up and between pictues.- Friendly GUI and easy to use/navigate/switch around.- Good handling feel.- Reasonably priced.Minuses:- Questionable longterm durability.  It doesn't have cheap feeling, just OK. But advertised as tough camera, I'd expect better build quality- Fingers will easily blocking the lens if not watching out for due to the off center and too close to the corner lens.- Joinstick might not be for everyone, easily got touch and changed setting by accident.- Lens cover mechanism might be easily stuck or break if turning on and off underwater (pressure) or stucked if sand got around it. (remember this is waterproof camera, using underwater and at the beaches will be used alot).Overall, this is a great general point and shoot cam.  Not the best cam but if combine the picture quality, the ability to use around/under water and the price I think it's the best choice at this time.

Reviews.Title: solid device and quick performance.
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my job, as I go around taking pictures for house inspections all day. So I needed something really sturdy that can handle a fair amount of abuse. After several days, this camera is a thrill to work with! It is quick.  Start up time is 1/2 of a second. The focus time is usually around 1/4 of a second. And the best of all, I dont need to worry about moving parts that always drain the heck out of my battery. In fact, The tiny metal lens cover snaps in and out of place with so much ease it is a joy to hear. The battery life is also much better than expected. It has lasted me 300 shots so far,, but that is considering I rarely use the flash, and I take continuous photos for every session. This camera is exactly what I needed for this purpose. Very solid in the hand, and it often feels like the controls are made to be tough and lont-lasting. All the buttons are tight and crisp. The joystick may feel a bit uncomfortable in the beginning. The first time I tried to use it, it would make mistakes occasionally. But trust me that after getting used to it, it is simply awesome and I now feel full control of how it operates! It is really built to withstand some harsh beating, and these controls aren't for a little girl with fragile hands. The screen brightness is surprisingly vivid, even in bright sunlight which is a lifesaver! The photos turn out to be VERY crisp, even with 2 mp setting. And that is clearly seen on the 3" hypercrystal display of this device. Very beautiful screen. I still need to try the video, but I dont necessarily need this camera for that.  The menu functions on this camera are more simple than what I'm used to, but there is a fair amount of tweeks available. Overall, I would give this camera 4.5 stars. The reason that it isn't a five is because the zoom function is a little on the low side. Only 5x optical, and you can tell that it struggles to keep up with zooming as far as quality goes. But that is a small price to pay. For everyone who is active outdoors and wants a practical camera that is fast, easy, and that will not get on your nerves, this one is it. Nikon aw150 is another good option to consider.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool camera, so far!
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera last minute in a scramble becuase of a nearing trip to Hawaii. I figured that I probably need a tough camera for the outdoors.After a couple of days of ownership, I've put this little bulky camera to the test, capturing images from every type of setting. From outdoor, green scenery, animals, underwater and in the city. so far the results of the images have impressed me. The only images I'm concerned about are the night images, its hard for the camera to focus and capture a good, clear shot. Maybe I ought to play a little more with the functions and see what will outcome from it.I was a bit concerned about the zoom after reading some comments, stating, that it was poor quality. I think it can be pretty fantastic if you can find the right balance. (see pictures)The camera allows me to get very artsy, with the cool fillers. The only bad thing about this is that you'll surely waste a lot of memory for one picture, capturing it from all the different options. (see pictures)I havent paid to much to the video camera but will try later.overall i think its a fantastic camera, thats quite speedy and captures very nice images.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Fast, Fast! And full HD video!
Reviews.Author: BuPhilOh
Reviews.Content: I received the TG-820 as a gift.  I am not a photographer, and I probably won't use it underwater or drop it or crush it.  But in every way that matters to me it beats the pants off similarly priced Canon digital cameras I've had.  Press the shutter and BAM! it immediately takes a clear, blur-free picture.  No delay.  In very low light with no flash I get little or no blur where other cameras have given worthless results.The full HD videos are also fantastic - very clear with no blur noticeable to my (critical but not professionally trained) eye, even when recording a band on stage in a dark club with no flash or extra light.  The sound was also very clear.Some reviewers complain about the joystick control, but I am able to use it easily with my thumbnail.  The lens being in the corner means you have to use care to keep the fingers of your left hand out of the way, but that takes just a minute to get used to.  Others complain about battery life, so I bought a second battery and charger here on Amazon.  But this wonderful camera takes all the video I need in an evening with battery capacity to spare.I've talked this camera up to my friends and if anything happens to it I won't hesitate to buy another just like it.

Reviews.Title: It's Really Tough but the Pics could be Sharper
Reviews.Author: J. Rowberg
Reviews.Content: We got this in advance of a beach trip a month ago.  Our fourth family camera in six years, I was going for something durable.  My four boys (oldest presently five) have destroyed every camera we've gotten.I'm very impressed with this one.  It takes fast pictures, so you don't miss the action.  It can take 3MP images at about 10 per second in burst mode, and 12 MP in single mode.  It has a flash and an LED for ultra-macro shots.  It takes full HD video.It's drop-proof (6 feet), sand-proof, and water-proof (33 feet).  I fell in love with this camera when a saw the cleaning instructions: "Submerge in fresh water for 10 minutes to remove sand and salt."My only disappointment is that the pictures are not crystal clear.  All the pixels in the world can't fix that.  They are focused, but they're grainy.  Now this camera is cheap as cameras go, so it's to be expected.  I might upgrade to a better Tough model if I get the cash.  As it is, a high-res pic scales down to desktop or 4x6 print size and looks amazing.  If you want to print 11x14, this may not be the best option.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter

Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my daughter, who is getting ready to move to the beach.  So far, she has used it in the ocean and in the pool, and it seems to be doing fine.

Reviews.Content: I am still not liking this camera:( The pictures are not very clear and the speed is not what I was expecting. The only part that I might like is that it's waterproof. Just not very happy.

Reviews.Author: MarkusR
Reviews.Content: We got this for a vacation to Sea World and I was a little worried about it getting wet from Shamu etc. Worked great. Mostly took videos. It will last about 1.5 hours of video taking. I either need to find better software or my expectation were too high. I took videos hoping to grab images from the video to post. However, with the provided software, the still shots from the videos were pretty blurry. Normal pictures look good. I would suggest people get this early, before the vacation and play with it to learn its pluses and minuses.

Reviews.Content: Overall the camera worked well. I have not tried it 10 meters under water yet. My biggest complain about this camera is the round toggle button. It sticks out too much and can be accidentally pressed even when you don't mean to.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: R. Harrington
Reviews.Content: Well I usually don't write reviews on products that I purchased, but felt like I needed to write one for this camera. My wife and I were going to Riviera Maya for our honeymoon and knew we were going to be in the water, so I was going to need a waterproof camera. After looking around on the web, I seen this camera from Olympus and decided to go with it based on the positive feedback and the price. The first few pictures were very clear and sharp and when I decided to venture into the water, again clear pics and videos! The camera is rated for 33' below water and on one outing we were 22' down and there were no issues. I actually did a 25 minute video that turned out great!A few tips: Get a second battery if you plan on doing a lot of videos and/or picture taken. I would suggest this with any camera.Two: When taking underwater pics/videos, once the lens door opens, make sure that there are NO air bubbles on the lens. A finger sweep is all you need to do.

Reviews.Title: Best Tough Camera for Me!
Reviews.Author: wluffman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and just took it with my wife on the Appalachian Trail for a few days and it took amazing pictures. If anyone expects to get amazing low light photos from a point-and-shoot, you are a moron!!! For that kinds of quality you need to fork over a few thousand for a great lens and high end DSLR full frame!!! Anyone that complains about poor low light photos has no idea what they are talking about!With that said... Obviously I took pics during the day and I can tell you, if this is when you are going to be using the camera most... GET IT! Awesome pics during the day, even pics up awesome detail of sun beams at dawn. The the ruggedness of this camera surpasses all the others out there that claim to be tough. It even has a metal shutter cover that activates when it is off or in picture viewing mode. I have had this camera for a few weeks and it does everything and more that I want it to. I have the the DSLR for low light pics and this is for back packing. So if you want an all round camera for outdoors, This is the one!

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-810 camera
Reviews.Author: poppy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus TG-810 camera for my wife and she can't stop raving about it.  She loves how compact it is and that it is so easy to handle.  She really enjoys using the magic features and has done a lot with the fragment, reflection, drawing and sepia functions.  We just returned from a Dixie Youth Baseball League tournament and she got some good action shots as well as portraits.  I'm very satisfied that I made the decision to purchase this camera for her.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jen1005
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I've taken it on vacations three times now and it takes great pictures! I was excited to use it in the water while we were at a water park and then snorkeling, and it worked great! It also has several options to make your pictures more colorful or other fun features... no complaints, worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Poor images - especially indoors
Reviews.Author: C. King
Reviews.Content: Having the same issues as other reviewers here and on other photo review web sites: the TG-820 seemingly cannot take a sharp indoor photo.  I've been shooting film and DSLR photography for years and except for 1 outdoor photo, could not get a sharp photo out of 80+ test shots.  I tried every available scene setting and exposure value (EV), various focal lengths, flash on & off, different lighting conditions and got the same result. Noisy images. I really want to keep the camera based on its handling and features - it was a gift for water sports - but in the end am forced to return it and purchase a non-waterproof camera with underwater housing.  The top manufacturer's waterproof cameras all seem to have either poor imaging and/or waterproofing failure issues.

Reviews.Content: Great camera, mostly use it for mountain biking and running around with the kids.  A bit heavier, but ruggedly build.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera

Reviews.Title: Delivered on Time

Reviews.Title: best camera ever

Reviews.Content: Love this purchase.! Got the blue one.  Got pictures of manatees Palm trees stuck the thing in the waves and the videos bring me chills. Panorama low light hd video. Over 860 pictures from one trip and I could have taken more

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Demo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife because she is a little hard on electronics, like dropping them. This product can take a licking and keep on ticking.I am very pleased with this camera and hope it last a long time.

Reviews.Title: The Good and the Bad
Reviews.Author: P H F "Designer of odd things"
Reviews.Content: Color is wonderful. Pictures look great up to a point. Nice feel to this camera and a double locking system for underwater shots is good. Definitely not a clunky camera, small and compact. It only shoots jpeg and in two sizes at that. You do not have the ability to shoot larger jpegs, maybe with less compression. I could find no way to fix this.I don't mind shooting jpeg as I can open them in Adobe RAW to work on them. However, the few pictures I took had too many artifacts and edge fringes for me. I couldn't fix them no matter what I did. At 100% pics showed edge noise. At 200% they were very bad. I tried defringing and noise reduction filters in Adobe Photoshop 6 without success. Also tried Nik.I know most people will love this camera and I tried to also. I own an Olympus MD E5 and like it a lot. I am a serious photographer going to the Galapagos and really wanted this to work. No luck.

The box does not come with a charger [at least mine did not] in the respect that you dont have a separate device to charge it. It comes with a plug that allows you to charge the battery in the camera.Bought as gift for my wife and we took it on our Jamaica trip and she loves it, so far.

Reviews.Title: Love these

Reviews.Content: This is not the first Olympus camera that I have purchased, and this one has lived up to same quality that I have come to expect from Olympus. From a film camera to other tough series models for my children, this one seems to be even better than those. I have had a number of opportunities to use it since I purchased it and I am quite satisfied with its performance.Others have discussed their difficulties with using this model but I feel they may not be used to how it functions. Reviews.Title: good enough

Reviews.Title: Owned for 2 years and now taking bad photos
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 years ago b/c I'm VERY hard on electronics. It used to take great photos and the high megapixle count is fantastic. But over the last few months, the 'auto' setting no longer takes good images. If I just turn it on and take a pic, it's almost always blurry. I have to go through the settings to select just the right one in order to get a non-blurry photo. Not sure what happened, but I'm very disappointed. It was great for a while - but I'd expect a $200 camera to last more than 2 years before the settings bust on it.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life Not Good At All
Reviews.Author: Highly Disappointed Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera out there as far as the battery life goes, I am on my second one because I returned the first one because the battery died after approximately 2 hours so returned it to get another one thinking that the first one was defective to find out the 2nd one was the same way with the battery life.  Took the kids to Sesame Place, arrived at 10 AM and by 12:00 noon could not take anymore pictures because the battery was dead and keep in mind I only took about 30 pictures and turned it off in between uses.  Would not recommend this camera at all!!!

Reviews.Title: Not as Tough as its name!
Reviews.Author: Abo of Park Slope
Reviews.Content: Based on Amazon feedback and websites that reviewed electronic items, I bought the Tough TG-820 for my vacation in the Philippines.  The reviews were right that it took wonderful photos, specially underwater.  However, just 2 weeks into my 5-month trip, the cover of the front viewfinder that slides with the on/off button got stuck and that was the end of that!  For a supposedly Tough camera, this one did not live up to its name and reputation!  The camera has great features all around but it isn't as tough as it is sold to be.  What a big disappointment!!

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera!
Reviews.Author: Weston Miller
Reviews.Content: Very durable and easy to use, no problems so far and I use it in the woods in all weather conditions..will buy again!

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Folding Smith
Reviews.Content: We have yet to take it to Hawaii for our honeymoon but that is why I bought it.  So far it is great-- takes very good pictures and is fairly easy to use.  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera

Reviews.Content: the item was bought as a gift in this not been opened yet.I know its good, cause I have an earlier model and a friend of mine has the same model price was excellent shipped and received on time

Reviews.Title: LOVE this Camera
Reviews.Author: Bedar Farley
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It is definitely my go-to, take everywhere camera.  It takes fantastic pictures and is easy to use.  I have taken it to waterparks, amusement parks, and snorkeling without any issues.  I don't have to be careful where I take it or how I handle it and the pictures turn out great.  I am amazed at the quality of the underwater shots.  I got about 150 pictures out of the battery before it had to be recharged.  No problems with the seals and I have it in water frequently.The only con I have is that it is easy to hit the on button and not be aware of it.  I do not take many videos, so I can't give a review of that function.Overall, great camera for general use and for places where you wouldn't want to take your high end digital SLR cameral.

Reviews.Title: Finally my camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy A. "book werm"
Reviews.Content: I have waited for four years to buy this camera.  I keep breaking all the others I have bought.  The price went down enough to push me over the provervial edge.

Reviews.Title: This product is excellent and performance is perfect
Reviews.Author: HENRY L. CONGER
Reviews.Content: It meets all expectations I had for this product.It performs fast and prompt.I would purchase again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: edena
Reviews.Content: This item arrived when expected and was exactly as described. The camera has not yet been used because it is a gift for a 16 year old. The price for a durable camera from a good quality maker was reasonable. Teens are a bit rough on things so the cheap $80 camera she had broke and this was the best replacement we saw available.

Reviews.Title: Not really satisfied with performance
Reviews.Author: konacoffeebean
Reviews.Content: Although camera has some nice features like Magic, panoramic, etc. the performance of video will intermittenly blur for a few seconds and then get clear and then blur and when you go to review video, you can see the blurred recording.  Also does the same while zooming in or out.  Battery does not stay charged very long.  Directional button does not go in proper direction all the time. You need to play with it alot to get it to go where you want it. Pressing button hard helps but not always. Have used it about a month now and wished I got a Canon. :( Using a sandisk extreme 32 gb 45 mb/s class 10  which manufacturer says is compatible. Well, now after less than a year, this camera died. The encasement is not secure to keep moisture out for an underwater camera. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera for my trip to Caribbean and it stopped working after couple snorkeling trips. I got it because it is advertised as underwater camera. Very disappointed. I have to say it took great pictures, but you should call it underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: Are you a beach lover? Or a parent of little ones? Or do you live in a place that rains? You will love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Rell
Reviews.Content: Get a squaretrade warranty.  And this camera.I live in Hawaii.  On the beach.  With children.  I bought the 2008 version of this camera and then our house flooded.  I have pictures of it all - the rain, the flood, the pool at the hotel where we stayed... and my favorite were the underwater pictures! The images were sharp, in and out of the water.  The sand, salt and sea were as nothing to this little trooper.  My baby teethed on it, my toddler dropped it and my elementary age child took loads of pictures - and it was alright because this camera is incredible! I took it everywhere and caught all those "moments" without worry of water damage or a cracked lens. For one year we did it all. And then it died.  So, we replaced in with the waterproof Canon. Meh. One year. And then it died. Then a Canon G12... and I can't take it to the beach or in the rain or underwater.  *sigh*  I miss my Olympus.  My babies can't teeth on the G12, or drop it.  I had a squaretrade warranty and it covered every camera that died - even the repair the G12 needed after one year. I will wait until the G12 dies for good... and go back to my waterproof Olympus. I love this camera!  Just remember to get squaretrade.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Borocay
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst cameras I have ever purchased.  The pictures were bad and the video was horrible. I find it hard to believe that the video this camera took was 1080p.  I never tried it in water because I returned it.  I will never buy another Olympus camera. If you want an excellent waterproof camera that takes true 1080p video then get a Panasonic TS5.  I used one in Cancun for two weeks and the pictures and video quality were excellent.

Reviews.Title: Dead after a couple hours out of the box.
Reviews.Author: P. ORRICK
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item refurbished, and I have many other items I have in my possession that are refurbished and still work perfectly. The TG-820 died on me after a couple minutes in the water. It started with beeping and turning off when I was trying to delete images/videos. Then I tried it in my pool, and after shooting one video, all it does is close and open the shutter, and the screen turns on for 5 seconds then black. I tried many solutions, but nothing works. I have never had an item die on me so quickly like this one.I am very angry as I was going to use this for an upcoming trip. I will never buy another Olympus product again, and urge you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: Not Tough Enough
Reviews.Author: Naomi Chavez
Reviews.Content: I am sadly disappointed. I read several reviews before purchasing 9 cameras for my business on May 24, 2012. (We use them to take pictures for condition reports of vehicles before shipping.) Ironically, 3 cameras "gave up the ghost" on the exact same day (Sept 6, 2012), about 3 1/2 months after purchase. Two of the cameras appear to have a cracked inner screen and the 3rd camera is simply not responding after powering up. They worked fine while they lasted, but I need reliability and the reliability of the camera was short lived.

Reviews.Title: not what i expected at all
Reviews.Author: Erica L. Fleming
Reviews.Content: This appears and functions as a dinosaur of a camera. It is very boxy. The weight of it is a bit unbelievable, this could be due to the features but i honestly cant believe it is a newer model. Opening the box I was initially concerned about how dusty it was, even had a fingerprint on it. It has a nice big and bright screen but it doesn't snap pics as quickly as the description stated which was a big selling point for me. This does lack buttons. Looking at it before purchase I thought I'd appreciate less but it is difficult to change options between shots, like turning the flash on and off. I am not happy with it at all. I was looking to spend money on a camera better than my current one but this is not it. Upset that will not be taking pictures with this or trying the waterproof feature. On top of my disappointment i have to pay a $6 fee and take it to a ups store for a refund and shipping and handling charge was redic.

Reviews.Content: I have bought olympus TG-820 15 days ago. when I had opened the box and tried to learn the camera specifications, I had seen that the AF is not working and an unnormal noise was coming from the zoom motor. Normally this camara had to  be tested before packaging.Since I couldn't use my camera yet, I have no idea for a review. But I will think twice if I will decide to buy another Olympus.

Reviews.Title: So far, I'm not really impressed
Reviews.Author: Robert Bailey
Reviews.Content: Adorama did a great job of getting it here quickly.The camera itself I don't know about yet because it is not charged. When I did fire it up and try to set the time it was very difficult; the joystick seems to have a sensitivity for small children. I ended up exiting before the settings were complete because I pushed something the wrong way, don't know what. The date/time stamp on the pix seems to be for GMT.This post is mostly about the manual. I understand that with print one needs to save paper and ink, this is a PDF. Please format it sensibly.> Start a new topic on a new page, please. You might find that the whole topic will fit on one page.> I found that if I zoomed enough to read it, I could not see it all at once. But if I could see it all at once I had to scroll up and down because it was in two columns. Sheesh.> As someone who has sold copies of my photos I appreciate the options. However, a waterproof camera implies fast and furious shots. How about two modes? Simple and "whatever you want"?I am an RTFM (Read the Manual) User. This one is not very good.I'll check back in later with more info after the camera (with no card included) is charged.I am disappointed....Bob
